ExpirationRuleHint.Default:
**Coupon Expiration Rule** Used to automatically calculate the expiration date of individual coupons. - **Days from encoding**: The coupon is valid "n" days after the purchasing date. - **End of week from encoding**: The coupon is valid until the end of the week of the purchasing date. If the coupon is purchased "n" days before the end of the week, the expiration will roll over to the next. - **End of month from encoding**: The coupon is valid until the end of the month of the purchasing date. If the coupon is purchased "n" days before the end of the month, the expiration will roll over to the next. - **End of year from encoding**: The coupon is valid until the end of the year of the purchasing date. If the coupon is purchased "n" days before the end of the year, the expiration will roll over to the next. - **One month from encoding**: The coupon is valid one month starting from the purchasing date. - **One year from encoding**: The coupon is valid one year starting from the purchasing date. - **Variable expiration date**: Operator will be asked to select one date. The coupon will be valid from the purchasing date to the selected date. - **Variable date range**: Operator will be asked to select two dates. The coupon will be valid between the selected dates. - **Variable validity day**: Operator will be asked to select one date. The coupon will be valid only the selected date. If quantity is specified, the coupon will be valid from the selected date for "n" days.
**Note** The rule is used only for individual coupons issued from the POS or through the SHOPCART APIs. The validity of individual coupons manually issued from the backoffice is selected by the operator.

EntitlementVersionHelp.Default:
The system will save the new entitlement configuration and mark all products that fall within the encode date range selected with a 'Refresh' status. The product entitlements will be automatically replaced when the product is specifically accessed by the system (unique search, product scan, financial task etc). In case of overlapping encode date ranges, SnApp will apply the entitlements of the last applicable override.
An example of the logic is provided below for clarity: 1. Product has a validity of 10 January - 25 January 2. An override is done to extend validity from 10 January - 30 January 3. Product is scanned on 20 January. Entitlements are automatically updated at time of product scan.
2nd scenario: 1. Product has a validity of 10 January - 25 January 2. An override is done to force early expiration and validity is shortened to 10 January - 20 January 3. Product is unused and has not been specifically queried by the system. Product will not expire on 20 January as expected since the product remains in a Refresh state.

SecUsageWaitDaysHint.Default:

InvoiceCodeFormatHint.Default: Invoice number format combines optional static values with incremental year and serial numbering. Static values are represented in single quotation marks. The year is represented by Y where the number of Y characters equals the total length of the year string. The serial number is represented by S where the number of S characters equals the total length of the serial number string. Incremental values are automatically calculated by the system and reset when the year changes. Invoice numbering examples: YYYY'-'SSSSS = 2020-00001 'A'YYYY'/'SSSS = A2020/0001 'AA'YYYY'-'SSSSS = AA2020-00001 If invoice number configuration is changed, the serial number will restart from 1.

PackageType_Hint.Default:
Determine how products are encoded:
**Merged products** - Encode 1 "package product" with entitlements as the result of a merge between the package and its "individual component products" entitlements
**Itemized products** - Encode 1 "package product" and N "individual component products"

PriceOnItemsHint.Default:
Determine how encoded products are priced and the choice affects revenue recognition behavior:
**Package** Package product is priced as sale price, while individual components are priced $0
**Individual components** Package product is priced $0, while individual components are priced as per their configuration in proportion to the package product sale price
-**Example:** - Package sale price = $375 - Child product one $150, quantity 2 - Child product two $200, quantity 1
-**Formula:** - (Package amount) : (Total amount of individual components) = X : (Individual component amount) Individual component 1 -> 375 : 500 = X1 : 150 -> 112.50 Individual component 2 -> 375 : 500 = X2 : 200 -> 150
-**Result:** - Package: $0 - Individual component 1: $112.50 x 2 - Individual component 2: $150 x 1

RedeemPackageHint.Default: Redemption is allowed against the package product only. Individual component products redemption is not allowed.

PropagateUsagesOnItemsHint.Default: Usages performed on the package product will be propagated to the individual components

GEP_CustomDataMappingHint.Default:
Mapping of SnApp product type's custom fields and GEP Entitlement fields.
Based on GEP ducumentation, there are 2 mandatory fields to be mapped: - **displayClassId** which represents the template to be used in GEP mobile app; - **description** which represents product type's extended textual description.
Any other SnApp custom field can be mapped with "GEP Field Name" which need to be agreed with GEP team for building a specific template to represent it. All custom fields will be mapped into "customData" node.

GEP_MissingMappingFields.Default: Some of GEP required mapping fields are missing: %1

UseNetworkCameraHint.Default: When disabled uses the system webcam. When enabled uses network camera (To enable this feature install VLC on your host)

ThresholdHighHint.Default: Minimum acceptable **score** for **Product type** Identity check level **HIGH**. The "**score**" is the result of the comparison from the Neoface library and ranges from **0** to **100000**.

ThresholdMediumHint.Default: Minimum acceptable **score** for **Product type** Identity check level **MEDIUM**. The "**score**" is the result of the comparison from the Neoface library and ranges from **0** to **100000**.

ThresholdLowHint.Default: Minimum acceptable **score** for **Product type** Identity check level **LOW**. The "**score**" is the result of the comparison from the Neoface library and ranges from **0** to **100000**.

EyesRollHint.Default: Specifies the range of eye tilt for face detection. Specifies the angle of rotation from horizontal to left or right, between 0 and 90 degrees. When face detection is performed in the default state, it detects face candidates with an eye tilt less than 15 degrees of earth.

EyesMaxWidthHint.Default: Specify the **maximum** eye spacing for face detection. When face detection is performed with the default settings, face candidates with an eye spacing of less than 240 pixels are detected.

EyesMinWidthHint.Default: Specifies the **minimum** eye spacing for face detection. When face detection is performed in the default state, face candidates with eye spacing greater than 80 pixels are detected.

FaceDetectionMinScoreHint.Default: The face detection score represents the likelihood of a face when detecting a face from an image. This parameter represents the minimun score allowed. Accetable values are betwenn 0 and **100000** where **100000** indicates maximum likelihood.

FaceDetectionTimeoutHint.Default: After this time an error will be raised if a face is **not** recoginzed. [ms]

ThresholdHighHint.Default: Minimum acceptable **score** for **Product type** Identity check level **HIGH**. The "**score**" is the result of the comparison from the Neoface library and ranges from **0** to **100000**.

ThresholdMediumHint.Default: Minimum acceptable **score** for **Product type** Identity check level **MEDIUM**. The "**score**" is the result of the comparison from the Neoface library and ranges from **0** to **100000**.

ThresholdLowHint.Default: Minimum acceptable **score** for **Product type** Identity check level **LOW**. The "**score**" is the result of the comparison from the Neoface library and ranges from **0** to **100000**.

EyesRollHint.Default: Specifies the range of eye tilt for face detection. Specifies the angle of rotation from horizontal to left or right, between 0 and 90 degrees. When face detection is performed in the default state, it detects face candidates with an eye tilt less than 15 degrees of earth.

EyesMaxWidthHint.Default: Specify the **maximum** eye spacing for face detection. When face detection is performed with the default settings, face candidates with an eye spacing of less than 240 pixels are detected.

EyesMinWidthHint.Default: Specifies the **minimum** eye spacing for face detection. When face detection is performed in the default state, face candidates with eye spacing greater than 80 pixels are detected.

FaceDetectionMinScoreHint.Default: The face detection score represents the likelihood of a face when detecting a face from an image. This parameter represents the minimun score allowed. Accetable values are betwenn 0 and **100000** where **100000** indicates maximum likelihood.

FaceDetectionTimeoutHint.Default: After this time an error will be raised if a face is **not** recoginzed. [ms]

SamePaymentWalletError.Default: Payment wallet cannot be the same as destination wallet

PortfolioSettlementHint.Default: Add to the shopping cart for portfolio settlement

SetMembershipHint.Default: Create a new order using this portfolio's privilege card

PortfolioSlotPointHint.Default: Selecting the reward point name will show the historical of the points.

ProductChangeFamilyError.Default: Product already belongs to the destination family

ProductChangeFamilySuccess.Default: Product succesfully added to the destination family

HidePortfoliosWithMediaDesc.Default: Hide all portfolios with at least one media assigned

PrintPortfolioStatementHint.Default: Print the current statement on a receipt

FullStatementHint.Default: Show full statement of selected membership point

LastPortfolioNotFound.Default: Unable to find last encoded portfolio

AssignPortfolioConfirm.Default: The portfolio is not linked to any account. Do you want to create a new one?

TicketPrincipalConflictError.Default: Unable to merge selected portfolio because already contains a product flagged as "principal"

AddNPrincipalsError.Default: %1 of the selected products are flagged as "principal" and cannot be added to the same portfolio

ExclusiveUseMergeNotEmptyError.Default: %1 portfolio contains "exclusive use" products and %2 portfolio is not empty

PortfolioConflictCreateAccountInsteadQue.Default: Do you want to create a new portfolio on the account instead?

TopupNotAllowedOnAny.Default: Top up operation is not allowed on any reward point

AccountMetaDataEngraveHint.Default: Saves a copy of the account's demographic fields. The fields saved at product level at the moment of the encoding.

AdvanceDaysHint.Default: Insert comma separate list of days (ie: 15,30,90)

AllowCrossLocationUpgHint.Default: Allows the product to be upgraded even to product types belonging to different locations. List of allowed locations need to be provided.

AutoRedeemOnSaleHint.Default: When the product is created on the db, it is automatically redeemed, using the access point controlled by the worstation which performed the transaction

BearedDiscountHint.Default: Discount amount will be ignored by the ledger rules

CanAttachOnlyToItsMedia.Default: Product can only be attached to its own media

ChangeExpirationDateHint.Default: This option allows the product expiration date to be manually changed

ChangeStartValidityHint.Default: This option allows the start validity date to be manually changed. This could affect the expiration date as well

ConfigPriceMaxError.Default: Absolute price %1 is greater than maximum set

ConfigPriceMinError.Default: Absolute price %1 is lower than minimum set

ConfirmEntitlementReplace.Default: %1 products are applicable for required selection

ConvertToBaseMeasure.Default: Convert to base unit of measure

ConvertToBaseMeasureHint.Default: Converts the specified unit of measures to the "base unit of measure" declared in the "unit of measure profile". This will keep homogeneous data in the warehouse stock.

CreateWizCloseWarn1.Default: No product type have been created. Are you sure you want to close the wizard?

CreateWizCloseWarn2.Default: Product types have been created anyway. Are you sure you want to close the dialog without any review?

EmptyProductIdError.Default: Please provide a valid product id

EndDeltaHint.Default: Delta days, calculated on source ticket end validity, up to which renewal can be done -10 means 10 days before ticket end validity +10 means 10 days after ticket end validity

EnforceSecondaryGroupHint.Default: The secondary ticket cannot be redeemed if the primary ticket has already unlocked other secondary tickets of the same family in a different time slot

AllowStandaloneSalesHint.Default: Allow secondary product to be sold even without a primary product in the same transaction

EntitlementOverrideWarning.Default: Warning: You are about to override already issued products with the current entitlements configuration. Expired or otherwise voided products will not be modified.

EntitlementReplaceHint.Default: Updates issued products with current entitlement configuration

ExpToleranceDaysHint.Default: Product cannot be expired by more than "n" days

ExpirationUsageTypeHint.Default:
**Expiration Usage Rule** Allows the Valid To date of the product to be dynamically updated by the system if fully used. - **As scheduled**: Product Valid To date will be determined by the entitlement configuration only - even if product is fully used. - **On full usage**: Product Valid To date will be automatically updated to the last redemption date when all the entitlements on the product are fully used. - **On full admission usage**: Configuration is applicable for when a product contains both admission entitlements and redeemable products. Product Valid To date will be automatically updated to the last redemption date when all available admission entitlements are used, even if redeemable products still remain. - **On full product usage**: Configuration is applicable for when a product contains admission entitlements and redeemable products. Product Valid To date will be automatically updated to the last redemption date when all available redeemable product entitlements are used, even if admission entitlements still remain.
**Example scenario:** - Product is valid from 1 January 2020 - 5 January 2020. - Product is configured for admission only and contains no but also contains redeemable products. - All admission entitlements are fully used on 1 January. - All redeemable products are used on 2 January.
**Result:** - **As scheduled**: Product Valid To date remains as 5 Jan 2020. - **On full usage**: Product Valid To date is dynamically updated to 1 Jan after last entitlement on the product is used. - **On full admission usage**: Product Valid To date is dynamically updated to 1 Jan after last admission entitlement is used. - **On full product usage**: Product Valid To date of product remains as 5 Jan 2020 is dynamically updated to 2 Jan after last redeemable product is used.

ExtMediaGroupHint.Default: When a product type is associated to an External Media Group, SnApp will not generate it's own barcode, but will pick one from a pre-imported list of barcodes belonging to a partner

FeeTransactionPercHint.Default: The price of this product will be calculated as a percentage of the transaction amount. If the products in the shopcart are set as "Tax included.", the percentage is calculated on the transaction GROSS total amount, else it is calculated on the transaction NET total amount.

PerformanceFutureDaysHint.Default:
Number of days, starting from performance's location current date, for which is possible to book a performance. - **0** means that performance can be booked only for the current day. - **1** means that only today and tomorrow performances can be booked.
The fields **regular** and **elevated** represent the allowed number of days respectively for **every user** and **users with override capability**. Access to **elevated** quantity needs anyway to be manually activated by users allowed to.

PerformanceFutureQtyHint.Default:
Maximum number of outstanding bookings allowed. Are considered *outstanding* all bookings for not ended performances.
The fields **regular** and **elevated** represent the allowed number of days respectively for **every user** and **users with override capability**. Access to **elevated** quantity needs anyway to be manually activated by users allowed to.

ForceMediaGenerationHint.Default: Force media generation and print when the product is sold. This option prevent the ability to handle this product in POS's "media organize" screen.

ForceReceiptPrintHint.Default: Activating this option receipt will print if product is sold even if "Print receipt on demand only" option is enabled

GroupTicketOptionHint.Default: Configure how tickets should be printed and redeemed for groups. - **No group**: Selling a quantity of 5 will print 5 tickets and each one needs to be redeemed individually. - **1 scan, N rotations**: Selling a quantity of 5 will print just 1 ticket. When redeeming the ticket, the turnstyle will allow for 5 rotations (which have to be done in any case, even if the group show up with fewer people). - **N scan, N rotations**: Selling a quantity of 5 will print just 1 ticket. When redeeming the ticket, the turnstyle will allow only for 1 rotation, but will allow the same ticket to be scanned again to allow the rest of the group to come in. Entries will be correctly accounted for the times the ticket get scanned.

PreventDirectSaleHint.Default: Product sellable only when dependant on another product (ie: "guest product" linked to a "host product") or when added as bonus item by a promotion

GuestAutoAddToCartHint.Default: When checked, guest products are automatically added to the shopping cart along with the host product

ForceDynAttrViewHint.Default:
When a product type contains dynamic attributes, clients (POS, B2B, etc...) display them for user selection when the product type is clicked. - **Standard view**: illustrates all attributes with all their options on 1 screen. This modality is suggested if you have only few attributes. - **Dynamic view**: illustrates all attributes, while their options are displayed in a popup menu only when clicking. This modality is enforced when having more than 8 attributes or anyway by **selecting this option**
*Please note that this option is only meaningful when the product type has dynamic attributes*

HidePriceVisibility.Default: Hide price visibility on guest display and receipt

IgnoreEncodedEntitlementsHint.Default:
**Default behavior (inactive)**: Static entitlements defined at product type level, are "engraved" on each encoded product. Any change made on product type's static entitlement will take effect only on products encoded after that change. At redemption time, static entitlements engraved on the product will be anyway merged with dynamic entitlements coming from the product type.
**Ignore encoded static entitlements (active)**: Any static entitlements engraved on the product will be ignored at redemption time, and only dynamic entitlements coming from product type will be considered

EditEntitlementStaticHint.Default: Edit entitlement rules, defined at product type level, which will be merged with attribute's entitlement rules and stored a product (ticket) level.

EntitlementStaticHint.Default: Static entitlements along with attribute entitlements are always merged and then saved against the product at the time of encoding. When static or attribute entitlements are modified, the effect will only be observed on products which are encoded after the modification has occurred. If changes to static or attribute entitlements for already encoded products is required, then the #Versioning feature should be used.

EditEntitlementDynamicEntityHint.Default: Edit entitlement rules, defined at product type level, which will be dynamically merged with product's (ticket) entitlement rules at redemption time.

EntitlementDynamicEntityHint.Default: Entitlements are saved against the product type and contribute to create the "merged dynamic" entitlements.

EditEntitlementDynamicHint.Default: View entitlement rules which will be dynamically merged with product's (ticket) entitlement rules at redemption time.

EntitlementDynamicHint.Default: Dynamic entitlements are saved against the product type and are only merged into a products’ entitlement tree at redemption time. Since they are not directly saved to the product itself until the moment of redemption, they can be freely added and removed to modify the behaviour of already encoded and newly encoded tickets.

EntitlementDynamicExample.Default:
**At sale time** (attribute entitlements): - 1 entry - Water Park Event
After ticket is sold, **dynamic entitlements** are added to the product: - 2 entries - Theme Park Event
**Upon redemption** (Entitlements are merged. In the case of conflicting entitlements -in this example the number of entries-, the dynamic entitlement will always take precedence - 2 entries - Water Park Event - Theme Park Event

IncludeBearedDiscountsHint.Default: Extends the clearing limit by the amount of the beared discounts

IncludeBearedTaxesHint.Default: Extends the clearing limit by the amount of the beared taxes

InvalidCalendarDay.Default: Selected day not valid on product calendar

InvalidDateError.Default: Product not sellable for the selected date

PrincipalHint.Default:
When encoded, the product will be identified as being a **principal** product. A portfolio may only contain one, active principal product. Non-principal products can be freely added to any portfolio. By default, product reissue/upgrade/downgrade of a principal product will not create a new portfolio.
Principal product information is stored at product type level. This means that activation of this parameter will also affect previously encoded products.
It should be noted that exceptions to principal product behaviour may be observed even after activation. Example: - Two products are already encoded and assigned to the same portfolio - The principal product parameter is subsequently activated on both products - SnApp will not automatically create a new portfolio. In this case, two principal products will be allowed to co-exist in the same portfolio.

ManualVerificationHint.Default: Determine how frequent a manual verification should be performed during access control: - **Never**: Never require manual verification. - **First use only**: Require manual verification on first use only. - **Daily first use only**: Require manual verification on first use of the day only. - **Random**: Require manual verification randomly with a probability of one out of N where N is the value of "Manual verification probability" configured at the topology level. - **Always**: Always require manual verification. - **Reentry only**: Require manual verification on reentries only.

MaterialAlternativeOptionHint.Default: Alternative option. Sub-materials can be selected as mutually exclusive alternatives when the product is sold

MediaEncoderPluginHint.Default: Allows to specify a media encoder plugin.

MediaPrintCodeAliasTypeHint.Default: When a product has a code alias for this code alias type, it will be printed (variable [@Ticket.MediaCode]) in place of the default SnApp barcode.

MediaExclusiveUseHint.Default: The media generated (if any) selling this product will be marked as "exclusive use", which will prevent any other product to be linked to same media. This option prevent the ability to handle this product in POS's "media organize" screen.

MediaConstraintsHint.Default:
Controls the maximum and minimum number of **active/blocked** media templates that can be assigned to this products’ portfolio. Also prevents unspecified media templates from being associated.
**Maximum** constraint values are always enforced by the system.
**Minimum** constraint values are used to initiate warning messages to the cashier in the POS (in case the minimums are not met) but do not prevent the transaction from proceeding.

MediaTemplateIsNotInput.Default: Product media template is not a media input

MembershipPointTargetHelp.Default: Reward points will be assigned to the selected entity

MultiEditAttrAccBioLedgerTempl.Default: Attribute / Account / Biometric / Ledger Rule Profile

MultiEditFacePrice_Line1.Default: Amount specified is a delta on current product face price, can be absolute or precentage (use %) and can be positive or negative.

MultiEditFacePrice_Line2.Default: When start date is specified, the delta will be applied to all price matrices with start date and end date that include date specified.

OrderDispatchCommonTemplatesHint.Default: Product will be printed in common templates only if sold from the same operating area of the printing station.

OrderDispatchSpecificTemplatesHint.Default: Product will be printed in specific templates regardless of the fact that the operating area of the station that sold the product is different from the one of the printing station.

OrderGuestOnlyHint.Default: Product sellable only on orders with a owner (for POS platform) or guest (for B2B platform) account.

OverlappingPriceMatrixError.Default: Overlapping date ranges are not allowed

PahGenerateMediaHint.Default: By selecting this option, SnApp will **encode a media** and print its barcode on the print@home. Default behavior (option not selected) is that SnApp prints a barcode which points directly to the product, not generating any media.

PeopleOfDeterminationHint.Default: Can be used to open special lanes at the access point

PerformanceTimeHint.Default: Product can be sold only when tied to a performance starting within the specified time range

PPURuleStopHint.Default: When the rule is applicable, the system will stop processing subsequent rules

PPURuleHint.Default: These rules are activated at admission only if the product has the entitlement option "PPU entry/reentry charge" set with no value and no charges are present on the Validate API request. A charge on a reward point is payable only by that same reward point. A charge on wallet (money) will be paid by wallet (money) first and if it is not enough, the remaining amount will be paid by the reward points configured with an exchange rate different than zero.

PreparationTimeHint.Default: Time (in minutes) required for the preparation of the item

PreventAdmissionHint.Default: When active, the redemption at the access point will be denied. This flag does not prevent the product to be encoded with its own entitlements.

PreventAdmissionEntitlementWarning.Default: Product is configured as Certificate, any redemption will be denied.

PriceSetupHint.Default: Select sale channels and performance types

Product.PriceSetupHint: 选择销售渠道和表现类型

PriorityOrderCheckTypeHint.Default: How many times the system checks the primary accesses against a secondary entry attempt

ProductFamilySelfReferenceError.Default: A product family cannot reference itself

ProductForceMediaError.Default: Product type "%1" requires its own media

FromVisitRefundDaysError.Default: Refund before the date of the visit no longer possible

NoRefundableProductError.Default: Unable to find any refundable product

NotSameDayRefundError.Default: Refund not allowed for products not paid today

ProductPriorityLevelHint.Default: "Secondary" tickets can exit only within "n" seconds after a "primary" ticket sold on the same transaction. The "n" seconds are set in location's configuration dialog: "product priority level" section. The primary ticket is linked to the secondary ones by the "portfolio group id value". A "portfolio group id" value defines a "family". If the accounts are created in the same transaction, both the "primary" and "secondary" tickets get the same "portfolio group id" value. If in a trasaction is selected an account with an associated "portfolio group id" value the new accounts created in the transaction will inherit the same "portfolio group id" value. If in a transaction are selected accounts with an associated "portfolio group id" value, every account will keep its own "portfolio group id" value.

ProductQuantityError.Default: Product minimum quantity is %1 with steps of %2

RefineProductTypeSearch.Default: Too many product types found. Refine the search

PromoBonusItemEmpty.Default: Please select at least one bonus item

PromoBonusProdWithOptions.Default: Bonus products must be added manually because of dynamic attributes.

PromoCombinableHint.Default: Promotion can be combined with other combinable promotions

PromoCombinableTagsHint.Default: Only promotions with these tags are combinable with this promotion.

PromoDisableTrnMinimumCap.Default: Apply even when discount is greater than transaction amount.

PromoDisableTrnMinimumCapHint.Default:
Not applicable for variable discounts. By default, absolute amount discounts are applicable only when the discount amount is less or equal the transaction amount (sum of all items matching promotion rule constraints). By activating this option, the discount will be applicable even when the transaction amount is less than the discount amount.
**Example** (The configured discount value is $15 and the transaction amount is $10): - **Option enabled**: the discount is applicable and the discounted amount is $10 - **Option disabled**: the discount is not applicable
**Example** (The configured discount value is $15 and the transaction amount is $20): - **Option enabled**: the discount is applicable and the discounted amount is $15 - **Option disabled**: the discount is applicable and the discounted amount is $15

PromoFilterByShopcartContentHint.Default: This promo will be activated if one of the following products is present in the shopcart or as transaction privilege card.

PromoMaxPerTransHelp.Default: Maximum times the promotion can be added to the same transaction. If the action is a percentage discount on the transaction, this parameter will reperesent the maximum number of items discountable by the promotion. In the case of individual coupon promotions, the max per transaction value refers to the maximum number of coupons that can be applied to the transaction.

PromoMinItemHelp.Default: The promotion will be active if the shopcart contains a number of items greater or equal to this value. If the "Min. item amount" is set, this count will consider only the items having an amount greater or equal to the "Min. item amount" value.

PromoPrdConstraintsHint.Default: Limits the applicability of the promotion within a time period per privilege card. It applies only to transactions linked to privilege cards.

PromoPrdNumberOfDaysHint.Default:
Optional field. Determines the number of days the system uses to calculate either the: - Benefit period: This applies when Last N days is selected - Benefit reset date: This value is only required if start of week/month/quarter/year has been selected as the benefit period and a specific day needs to be used to calculate the benefit reset date.
Examples: Staff member is eligible to receive 4 free tickets each week. Max Items: 4 Benefit Period: Start of Week Number of Days: Leave empty
Staff member is eligible to receive 4 free tickets every 30 days. Max Items: 4 Benefit Period: Last N days Number of Days: 30
Staff member is eligible to receive 4 free tickets with their benefit resetting on the 10th day of each month. Max Items: 4 Benefit Period: Start of Month Number of Days: 10

PromoPrdMaxItemCountHint.Default: Sets the maximum number of times the benefit can be availed by the privilege card holder during the period. Unused benefits do not roll over to the next period.

PromoBenefitPeriodHint.Default: Determines how the system should calculate the benefit period.

PromoShopcartRemovedWarning.Default: The promotion "%1" has been removed from the shopcart because is not applicable

PromoTagFilterHelp.Default: The discount will be applied only to products with the selected tags

PromoTriggerQuantityMinHint.Default: If either category or product type is selected, it represents the minimum quantity to qualify for the discount. If wallet deposit is selected, it represents the minimum amount.

PromoTriggerQuantityStepHint.Default: If either category or product type is selected, it represents the step quantity of the products that will trigger the quantity of the discount accordingly. If wallet is selected, it represents the step amount that will trigger the quantity of the discount accordingly.

PromoVariableDiscountHint.Default: Discount amount/percentage will be set during sale. Available for manual promotions only.

TrnMaxQtyHint.Default: Max quantity for the specific product type allowed in an order. NOTE: Same product type sold with different prices is still included in the calculation to check the limit

RevRec_ApplyOnTotalHint.Default:
When **flagged**, SnApp will allocate revenue by gate category based on the total clearing limit of the product. When **not flagged**, SnApp will allocate revenue by gate category, less any absolute amounts.
Example: - Tax Exempt ticket valued at $100 - Clearing Limit 100% - Gate Category 1 Admissions - 100% - Gate Category 2 F&B - $20
Result: - **Flag on**: Gate Category Allocation $100 admissions|$20 F&B - **Flag off**: Gate Category Allocation $80 admissions|$20 F&B

RevRec_ExtractFromGrossHint.Default:
When selected, the percentage is calculated based on the total clearing limit as "gross".
Example: If the percentage is 10% and the clearing limit is $1100, the result should normally be $110 (as $110 is 10% of $1100). By selecting this flag, the calculation would return $100.

RewardPointClearingHint.Default:
**IMPORTANT** When product is configured as **"Bind wallet/reward points to product"** clearing will apply to points directly linked to the ticket (ex. initial deposit specified in the entitlements) and not to portfolio points amount (ex. topup from account).
When product is **NOT** configured as **"Bind wallet/reward points to product"** clearing will apply to portfolio points excluding points directly linked to the ticket.
Event that will trigger the reward point clearing - **Clearing**: Points cleared upon product clearing - **Breakage**: Points cleared upon product breakage - **Expiration**: Points cleared upon product expiration - **Portfolio expiration**: Points cleared only if all products in the portfolio are expired or are expiring all thogeter (not applicable if "Bind wallet/reward points to product")

TicketVoidAdvanceDaysHint.Default:
Allows to set a date threshold until when the refund is allowed. The threshold defines the number of days based on **visit date** until which refund is allowed. In case of the system is not able to calculate the **visit date** (ex. general admission products), the system will use as reference date, if exists, the **first usage date** otherwise the **validity end date**.
- **not set**: Refund always allowed - **-1**: Refund allowed until 1 day before visit date - **0**: Refund allowed until same day of visit date - **1**: Refund allowed until 1 day after visit date
**Example scenario:** Visit day: 31 December 1999
**Result:** - **not set**: Refund always allowed - **-1**: Refund allowed until 30 December 1999 - **0**: Refund allowed until 31 December 1999 - **1**: Refund allowed until 1 January 2000

TicketVoidAdvanceFeeDaysHint.Default:
Configure a fee to be charged to the guest when performing product refunds. Allows to also set a date threshold from when the fee should be applied. The threshold defines the number of days based on **visit date** until which the fee is not applied. In case of the system is not able to calculate the **visit date** (ex. general admission products), the system will use as reference date, if exists, the **first usage date** otherwise the **validity end date**.
- **not set**: Fee is always applied - **-1**: Fee not applied until 1 day before visit date (included) - **0**: Fee not applied until same day of visit date (included) - **1**: Fee not applied until 1 day after visit date (included)
**Example scenario:** Visit day: 31 December 1999
**Result:** - **not set**: Fee is always applied - **-1**: Fee not applied until 30 December 1999. Fee is applied starting from 31 December 2000. - **0**: Fee not applied until 31 December 1999. Fee is applied starting from 1 January 2000. - **1**: Fee not applied until 1 January 2000. Fee is applied starting from 2 January 2000.

TicketVoidSizeFeeListMismatch.Default: Size of the fee list provided doesn't match calculated fee list size

ProductTypeRenewalPolicyError.Default: Product type does not match selected product's renewal policy

RequireAccountHint.Default: When active, the operator is prompted to fill in the ticket owner data according to the selected category. The "Require account" options determine when the user’s account information needs to be collected: - **On sale**: The user’s account information must be provided before finalizing an order. This is required even if the order is only approved or paid. It's the default value, and it's set to true when the other options are false. It's not an actual product flag so it does not show up in history details. - **On encoding**: The user’s account information will be collected just before encoding. The order can still be finalized as approved or paid without this information. - **On redemption**: The order can always be finalized. If the guest holding the ticket does not have their account information registered, they will be denied entry at the access gate. They will need to visit guest services to register their personal information.

RenewableFromAnyHint.Default: This product type can be selected as the "renewal target" of any product having the option "Renewable to any product". The operator is responsible to select an appropriate matching.

RenewableToAnyHint.Default: Encoded products of this type can be renewed to any product type having the option "Renewable from any product". The operator is responsible to select an appropriate matching.

RequiredPluginsHint.Default: Product sellable only from POS running all listed plugins. When empty, no restriction related to plugins is applied.

MembershipPluginHint.Default: Interface to an external membership validator

RestrictPaymentMethodsHint.Default: Defines what are the allowed payment methods when the product is sold. The available payment methods are the intersection between all product's restrictions in the shopping cart. If the flag is unchecked no restrictions on payments will be applied.

ProductNegativeTransactionHint.Default: Determine if product type can be used in a *"negative transaction"* - **NOT ALLOWED**: product type can be used only in **positive** transactions - **ALLOWED**: product type can be used both in **positive** and **negative** transactions - **NEGATIVE ONLY**: product type can be used only in **negative** transactions

RevenueRecognitionTabSerialNumberHint.Default: Each tab has its own serial number used for reference in the history detail list

AmortizationPeriodsProcessWarning.Default: * Installment contract linked to the product is blocked. Amortization periods will either be processed or not based on finance reconciliation task configuration

RevRecDateGap.Default: Revenue recognition configuration cannot contain date gaps. First date range has to start from "always" and last date range has to end with "always"

InvalidProductRevenueDateSerialNumber.Default: Invalid product revenue date serial number

SaleConstraintsHints.Default: In order to sell this product type, it needs to be linked to an account (even if anonymous) which already owns at least one of the following product types

SimulatedSellDate.Default: The calendar shows the prices that will be applied on "reference date"

SpecialProductDoNotOpenApt.Default: Special product, prevent opening access point

SpecialProductDoNotOpenAptHint.Default: When this product is used at an access point as a special product, the access point will not open (0 rotations)

StartDeltaHint.Default: Delta days, calculated on source ticket expiration, up from which renewal can be done -10 means 10 days before ticket expiration 10 means 10 days after ticket expiration

TaxablePercHint.Default: Product price's portion on which the tax is applicable

TaxInInvoiceHint.Default: Mark transaction as to be invoiced

TaxRateOverlappingError.Default: Overlapping tax rate validity dates are not allowed

TransferableHint.Default: This option enables products to be transferred between different accounts.

UsedProductsHint.Default: Number of days from first usage, after which upgrade will be prevented

ExpirationUpgradeDaysHint.Default: Number of days from product expiration, after which upgrade will be prevented

FromVisitUpgradeDaysHint.Default:
Number of days based on **visit date**, until which upgrade is allowed. In case of the system is not able to calculate the **visit date** (ex. general admission products), the system will use as reference date, if exists, the **first usage date** otherwise the **validity end date**.
- **not set**: Upgrade always allowed - **-1**: Upgrade allowed until 1 day before visit date - **0**: Upgrade allowed until same date of visit date - **1**: Upgrade allowed until 1 day after visit date
**Example scenario:** Visit day: 31 December 2020
**Result:** - **not set**: Upgrade always allowed - **-1**: Upgrade allowed until 30 December 2020 - **0**: Upgrade allowed until 31 December2020 - **1**: Upgrade allowed until 1 January 2021

FromVisitUpgradePerfDaysHint.Default:
Number of days based on **visit date**, until which is possible to change visit date while upgrading. - **not set**: Upgrade always allowed - **-1**: Upgrade allowed until 1 day before visit date - **0**: Upgrade allowed until same date of visit date - **1**: Upgrade allowed until 1 day after visit date
**Example scenario:** Visit day: 31 December
**Result:** - **not set**: Upgrade always allowed - **-1**: Upgrade allowed until 30 December 2020 - **0**: Upgrade allowed until 31 December 2020 - **1**: Upgrade allowed until 1 January 2021

LimitUpgradeMaxTimesHint.Default: Limit the max number of subsequent upgrades allowed. Configured in "Licensee \ Configuration dialog » Advanced \ Max upgrades/downgrades"

ChangePerformanceAdvanceDaysHint.Default:
Number of days based on **visit date**, until which a performance change is allowed
- **not set**: Performance change always allowed. - **-1**: Performance change allowed until 1 day before visit date - **0**: Performance change allowed until same date of visit date - **1**: Performance change allowed until 1 day after visit date
**Example scenario:** Visit day: 31 December 2020
**Result:** - **not set**: Performance change always allowed - **-1**: Performance change allowed until 30 December 2020 - **0**: Performance change allowed until 31 December 2020 - **1**: Performance change allowed until 1 January 2021

ChangeVisitDateFeeHint.Default:
Charge a fee when changing visit date on an encoded product: - **Fee**: product type fee applied; it also determins the fee amount. - **Days**: number of days based on **visit date**, until which the visit date can be changed.
**Days:** - **not set**: Fee is always applied - **-1**: Fee is not applied until 1 day before the visit date (included) - **0**: Fee is not applied until same day of visit date (included) - **1**: Fee is not applied until 1 day after the visit date (included)
**Example scenario:** Visit day: 31 December 2020
**Result:** - **not set**: Fee is always applied - **-1**: Fee is applied starting from 30 December 2020 - **0**: Fee is applied starting from 31 December 2020 - **1**: Fee is applied starting from 1 January 2021

UpgradePreventChangePerformanceHint.Default: When enabled, a user will be prevented from changing the performance time during an upgrade/downgrade transaction. The ability to change the performance date during an upgrade/downgrade remains subject to the constraints set under the "Change Visit Date" parameter.

IgnoreAdmissionStatisticsHint.Default: Product type will not be considered for any admission statistic

UpgradeLocationNotAllowed.Default: Destination product type not allowed due to location restrictions

UpgradeUsedTicketHint.Default: Allows the product to be upgraded also if already used

VariableDescriptionHint.Default: Activating this option, the operator will be prompted when trying to sell this product, asked to enter a 'custom ticket description' to be used instead of the default (product type name)

VarpriceNewPresetAmountHint.Default: Enter absolute amount (ie '10' for '$ 10,00') or percentage amount (ie '10%' for '10 %')

VariablePriceFreeInputHint.Default: Allow then operator to manually enter the desired amount. Amount will anyway be capped between min/max configuration.

WalletClearingHint.Default:
**IMPORTANT** When product is configured as **"Bind wallet/reward points to product"** clearing will apply to wallet directly linked to the ticket (ex. initial deposit specified in the entitlements) and not to portfolio wallet amount (ex. topup from account).
When product is **NOT** configured as **"Bind wallet/reward points to product"** clearing will apply to portfolio wallet amount excluding wallet amount directly linked to the ticket.
Event that will trigger the wallet clearing - **Clearing**: Wallet cleared upon product clearing - **Breakage**: Wallet cleared upon product breakage - **Expiration**: Wallet cleared upon product expiration - **Portfolio expiration**: Wallet cleared only if all products in the portfolio are expired or are expiring all thogeter (not applicable if "Bind wallet/reward points to product")

WritePerformanceAccountHint.Default: When this product type gets sold, if it has a performance reference, that performance will be marked with the "product owner" account

AmortizationPeriodsHint.Default: When set to auto, periods will be scheduled automatically within expiration date. If product has no expiration date no amortization periods will be scheduled

AmortizationDelayHint.Default: If different from zero, periods will be scheduled by "Finance reconciliation" task "Delay days" after start validity of the product.

AmortizationWithinExpirationHint.Default: When checked, at time of period scheduling, no periods with date after expiration date can be scheduled. If expiration date changes after, scheduled periods will NOT be updated.

BreakageValueNotAllowed.Default: Negative breakage value is not allowed

AmortizationPeriodValueNotValid.Default: "Periods" not valid unless "Periods within expiration date" is checked

VistitPerTicketNotValid.Default: Visit per ticket value not valid

DateFromGreaterThanDateTo.Default: Date from [%1] cannot be greater than date to [%2]

RevenueRecognitionGateEmpty.Default: Cannot create a revenue recognition without revenue recognition gate

RevenueRecognitionVPTValueNotValid.Default: Visit per ticket value not valid

RevenueSetupDialog.Default: Select sale channels and performance types

RevenueRecognitionFixedAmountWarn.Default: One or more clearing limit value(s) are expressed in absolute amount. Confirm the changes?

RevenueRecognitionPercentageAmountWarn.Default: Total percentage is different from 100%. Confirm the changes?

RequireOrganizeStepHint.Default: When the product is sold, POS will display the "Media organize" screen, which allows to group media and products into portfolios. This option is ignored when "Force media print" or "Media exclusive use" are selected.

MediaAlreadyExistingHint.Default: Only media ALREADY registered into the system can be used

MediaNotExistingHint.Default: Only media NOT registered into the system can be used

RevalidationHint.Default: Extend the expiration date of the products

FeeProductIdHint.Default: Product Fee to be used in the revalidation transaction.

ExtensionDaysHint.Default: Number of days the product expiration will be extened for.

RevalidationStartDaysHint.Default: Revalidation window opening. Delta days from the original expiration date.

RevalidationEndDaysHint.Default: Revalidation window closure. Delta days from the original expiration date.

WindowStartEndDaysErrorMessage.Default: Window start days must be less than Window end days

RevalidationStartEndDaysErrorMessage.Default: Revalidation start days must be less than Revalidation end days

AutoGenDocAfterPaymentHint.Default: Force the generation of the document to happen after the payment screen. This makes it possible to use transaction variables (ie: TDSSN) in the template.

PrintValidityDescOnTrnReceipt.Default: Print validity description on transaction receipt

PrintValidityDescOnTrnReceiptHint.Default: The option allow to print validity description on transaction receipt (the validity description variable has to be correctly set on the template receipt.

ProdTypeSearchNotFoundMessage.Default: Product can only be selected from an event

DatedProductConstraintError.Default: Invalid date "%1" for product "%2". Date must be within "%3" and "%4"

ValidateSecurityRestrictionHint.Default: Requires a user with appropriate permissions when attempting to validate an order containing this product

ValidateFromVisitDateHint.Default: Ensure that an order containing this product can only be validate starting from the visit date

ValidateFromVisitDateError.Default: Product "%1" cannot be validated before visit date

GateCategoryHint.Default: Gate category used when redeeming included products linked to this product in the entitlements

EntitlementReplaceWizard_Description1.Default: This wizard allows to replace entitlements on encoded products.

EntitlementReplaceWizard_Description2.Default: Expired or otherwise voided products will not be modified.

Upsell_TargetProductSwapHint.Default: Product type offered as a "replacement" of the triggering one (like a "direct upgrade")

Upsell_SamePortfolioHint.Default: Add upselled product to the same portfolio as the main/triggering one

Upsell_QuantityMinHint.Default: Upsell minimun quantity constraint. When the upsell is configured as "same portfolio" the constraint is verified per portfolio, otherwise per order.

Upsell_QuantityMaxHint.Default: Upsell maximum quantity constraint. When the upsell is configured as "same portfolio" the constraint is verified per portfolio, otherwise per order.

Upsell_SwapConfirm.Default: Do you want to swap item "%1" with "%2" for %3

Upsell_WalletActionHint.Default: Set wallet deposit on all selected items

StopSaleCalendarHint.Default:
Dates for which the product is not sellable. Stop sale dates also impacts on upgrades/downgrades. If the source product is booked for a date and the target product has a "stop sale" on that same date, the upgrade/downgrade is not allowed.
There is one exception where the upgrade/downgrade will be permitted regardless if the target product is on a stop sale date: - The target product's start date is the same as the source product's start date **AND** - The target product's number of **entries** is the same or less than that of the source product's number of entries **AND** - The stop sale date is **SOFT** (or even **HARD** in case the source product is a **certificate**)
**SOFT** and **HARD** stop sale dates: To allow for the exception as described above, it is possible to specify individual days on the "stop sale calendar": - **SOFT** stop sale: an upgrade/downgrade is permitted under certain conditions; - **HARD** stop sale: an upgrade/downgrade is not allowed.

StopSaleError.Default: The selected product is currently not for sale.

StopSaleOverrideConfirm.Default: Would you like to add the product to the cart anyway?

StopSaleUpgradeSoftError.Default: The selected product does not meet the criteria for modification due to the following reason(s):

StopSaleUpgradeHardError.Default: The selected product is currently not available for upgrade/downgrade.

BearedTaxHint.Default: When flagged, tax linked to the product can concur on increasing the clearing limit

ExternalCheckCouponRedeemHint.Default: When flagged, SnApp will check existing individual coupon used at redemption also on external systems to validate status and validity. When the individual coupon is redeemed, SnApp will mark it as redeemed on external systems as well.

SuspendDateFromInThePast.Default: Start date cannot be in the past

SuspendDateFromAfterDateTo.Default: Start date cannot be after end date

SuspendDateFromNotChange.Default: Start date in the past cannot be changed

SuspendDatesOverlap.Default: Selected dates overlap with dates from another period (%1 to %2)

SuspendDateToInThePast.Default: End date cannot be in the past

SuspensionHint.Default:
During suspension periods products encoded linked to the product type are subject to the following rules: Finance reconciliation task ignores suspended products and does not trigger any expiration operation or amortization period Entry is not permitted for suspended products No usage, expiration and amortization periods ledger movements are performed on suspended products
When products transition from a suspended period to an active periods the following rules apply: Expiration rule is recalculated based on the number of days of suspension(s) when the product is used or when the finance reconciliation task pick it up due to original expiration date Amortization periods are recaluclated based on the number of days of suspension(s) when the product is used or when the finance reconciliation task pick it up due to period original date

ProductTypeSuspendedTillUnlimited.Default: Product type is suspended for an unlimited period of time

ApplyTaxOnFacePriceHint.Default: Taxes are calculated based on face price regardless of sale price or discounts

PerformanceSelectionTypeHint.Default:
Determine if and how a performance should be linked to the product. - **Not required**: General admission - **Before encoding**: Performance selection before encoding - **Before usage**: Performance selection before usage
NOTE: The value has effects only if the performance selection in the entitlements configuration is set as "Dynamic"

BindWalletRewardToProductHint.Default: Bind any wallet amount or reward points embedded in the product type entitlements to the **product** instead of the **portfolio**. All redemptions made against available wallet/reward points shall be limited to the balances left on the **product** only.

WalletRewardSingleUseHint.Default: Allow one time use against any available balances. Once used, unused balances (if any) will be automatically taken as breakage. Applicable only for products containing wallet or reward points.

WalletRewardPayPartialHint.Default: Allow to be used to partially pay a "Pay per use" transaction initiated by another product, in the same portfolio, with insufficient funds.

NotPrintableAtUnmannedWksHint.Default: Prevents the product to be printed at stations where an operator is not present like Kiosk, B2C, etc.

IssueForRefundHint.Default: Product type can be added to the shop cart during a refund (order or product) to be sold instead of returning money. The price will be assigned by the system and will be the remaining amount to be refunded, regardless of the price configuration of the product type.

PortfolioPriorityHint.Default:
Determines how the product should be organized in the portfolio list when sold. 1 represents the highest priority, empty represents the lowest priority. Example: - Product A is configured with no priority - Product B is configured with Priority "1" - Product C is configured with Priority "2"
When all three products are sold, the portfolio product list will reflect: 1. Product B 2. Product C 3. Product A
When issuing a new product, if the portfolio already contains other items with the same priority, the new product will be inserted after the last active item in the list with the same priority. Manual product prioritization can always override this portfolio sorting.

GateCategoryPercRuledescription.Default: IMPORTANT: When the clearing limit is expressed as a percentage, the last gate category receives the remaining clearing amount regardless of the configured percentage so as to avoid under or over allocation from occurring.

NoValidTemplate.Default: No valid printer found for receipt template %1

ReceiptDetailHint.Default: Full receipt including all transactions settled

ReceiptConsHint.Default: Groups all items purchased in different transactions

PrintReceiptFailed.Default: Something unexpected happened while printing the transaction receipt. The receipt can be printed from the transaction detail view.

Status_Waiting.Default: Waiting - Printer plugins need to be initialized

Status_Stopped.Default: Stopped - One or more printer plugin cannot be initialized in a decent timeframe

RequireParsingHint.Default: When attached to order confirmation emails, the document get parsed and filled in with dynamic variables. Works only with Word files

DistinctAttachmentHint.Default: When attached to order confirmation emails, attach 1 copy for each guest

ConvertToPDFHint.Default: When attached to order confirmation emails gets converted into PDF format

CreateWaiverDraftHint.Default: Create a draft based on a "waiver" template

ChangeResOwnerOnPaidOrdersHint.Default: Ability to change reservation owner on: - unpaid reservation: always allowed - paid reservation: controlled by this right - validated reservation: never allowed

SetGuestAccountHint.Default: Set this account as guest account in the reservation

Reservation.SetGuestAccountHint: 在预定中将此账号设置为游客

ChangeResOwnerWarning.Default: Do you want to change the reservation owner from "%1" to "%2"

AccountReservationCreateHint.Default: Create a new reservation on this account

Reservation.AccountReservationCreateHint: 为当前账号创建预定订单

CannotDeleteActiveUsedTicketError.Default: Unable to delete reservation. There are some active used tickets

Reservation.CannotDeleteActiveUsedTicketError: 无法删除预订订单，有有效门票

CannotDeleteSaleWithVoidedTicketError.Default: Unable to delete reservation. There are some tickets individually voided

CannotDeleteSaleWithInstallmentTicketErr.Default: User does not have rights to void orders containing an installment contract

LastAccountHint.Default: Create a new reservation based on the last res.owner account used

Reservation.LastAccountHint: 根据上笔预订创建预定订单

LastReservationHint.Default: Load the last reservation opened by this workstation

Reservation.LastReservationHint: 加载该终端打开的上笔预定订单

ActionsHint.Default: Show all communications related to this reservation

Reservation.ActionsHint: 显示所有的通信与此预订
Reservation.NotesHint: 创建或编辑预订订单备注

LastResEmailNotFoundError.Default: No e-mail found for last reservation

Reservation.LastResEmailNotFoundError: 没有电子邮件去年预订

ReservationSplitHint.Default: Split products on an existing and open reservation

SplitTargetAccountError.Default: Cannot change the target account if a target order is selected

BatchPrintNoOrderError.Default: No order found in the required batch

NotPrintedMediaWarning.Default: There are %1 media not printed. Do you want to print them now?

Reservation.NotPrintedMediaWarning: 有%1张媒介未被打印。请确认是否现在打印？

SetAsPaidQuestion.Default: Set order status as 'paid' and proceed?

VoidWindowWarning.Default: The order falls outside the configured cancellation window

HandoverTransactionNotEditable.Default: Current order cannot include product not selected from inventory

DuplicatedEntityIdError.Default: Cannot create multiple resources over the same entity: %1

NotAvailableExt.Default: There is no more availability of the resource for today

ResourceNotFoundOnMediaError.Default: Resource not assigned to the account

HandOverDateTimeError.Default: Hand over date/time allowed only between %1 and %2

ResourceMatchError.Default: None of the required resources complies with your selection' skills.

EventNotResourceError.Default: Event "%1" does not require any resource

AccountNotAvailableError.Default: Account "%1" is not available for the required time frame

SerialNotAvailableError.Default: Unable to find an available "%1" serial for the required time frame

SoldOutError.Default: Not available at selected time slot

RemoveConfirmMsg.Default: Do you want to remove resource management configuration for this item?

CreatePerformanceHint.Default: Auto-create a performance for the selected event when the product is sold

LocationHint.Default: The reward point rule applies only to redemptions made at the selected location.

OperatingAreaHint.Default: The reward point rule applies only to redemptions made at the selected operating area.

AccessPointHint.Default: The reward point rule applies only to redemptions made at the selected access point.

EventsHint.Default: The reward point rule applies only to products redeemed at the selected event(s).

ProductTypesHint.Default: The reward point rule applies only to product(s) of the selected tag(s).

ResetConfirm.Default: Do you want to remove all settings at this level?

LoadPortfolioRecalcTicketVersionHint.Default: Recalculate products entitlement version (for those products which need it) when API PORTFOLIO\LoadPortfolio is called. NOTE: activating this option can degradate the API response time.

SaleCodeTypeHint.Default: - **8 characters**: Potential PNR duplication in 3 years. - **10 characters**: Potential PNR duplication in 89 years.

OverrideFailedRedemptionHint.Default: Enables operators logged on an access point to force gate opening for failed scans which do not have a specific right

LogSimulatedRedemptionsHint.Default: When enabled, simulated redemptions will be saved along with regular redemptions, but no values will be decremented

SimulateRotationsForAutoRedeemablesHint.Default: For every product type with option "automatic redemption on sale" which is sold, automatically record a rotation in statistics

OverrideMissingPerformanceHint.Default: Skip the redemption/validation check for which "before usage" entitlements require a performance to be booked in order to redeem a ticket

CheckBeforeUsagePerformancesHint.Default: On the redemption/validation process, check that performances have been properly booked for entitlements having "before usage" option. By disabling this option, "before usage" entitlements will act like comme "general admission".

CheckCrossoverTimeRangeHint.Default: On the redemption/validation process, check entitlement's time range contraints for crossovers.

OverrideBlockedAccountRedemptionHint.Default: Enables operators logged on an access point to force gate opening for failed scans when account is blocked

OverrideBlockedProductRedemptionHint.Default: Enables operators logged on an access point to force gate opening for failed scans when product is blocked

OverrideBlockedMediaRedemptionHint.Default: Enables operators logged on an access point to force gate opening for failed scans when media is blocked

OverrideInvalidPerformanceHint.Default: Enables operators logged on an access point to force gate opening for failed scans when booked performance (on performance events) is mismatching

OverrideInvalidDayPerformanceHint.Default: Enables operators logged on an access point to force gate opening for failed scans when booked performance (on gad/dated events) is mismatching

UpdateIgnoreCrossoverTimeRestrictionsHin.Default: Ability to override product's "crossover time range" restrictions

SoftwareManualUploadHint.Default: Ability to manually upload software updates (ie: extension packages)

HighlightedNoteHint.Default: The "Create" level allows the user to flag notes as "highlighted" at time of note creation. The "Edit" level allows the user to add/remove "highlighted" flag on any note.

GridDownloadHint.Default: Ability to download backoffice grids (in every context) in CSV/Excel format

ConfirmBoxStartingFundHint.Default: Requires the operator to manually input the box starting fund at the beginning of the shift. If the amount does not match the configured one, supervisor override is required to continue.

ShowOnlyHighlightedNotesByDefault.Default: Show only highlighted notes by default

ShowOnlyHighlightedNotesByDefaultHint.Default: If enabled only highlighted notes will be show by default on BKO and POS

NoteDeleteHint.Default: Allow users to delete notes. Once a note is deleted, its' content cannot be recovered.

SimultaneousLoginBackofficeAndPOSHint.Default: Allow a user to simultaneously login in both Backoffice and POS modules

EditOwnProfileHint.Default: Ability, for an operator, to modify it's own account profile.

PaymentCommitTextHint.Default: Text to be displyed on B2B/CC module on the payment/commit screen

RequireBagNumberOnFinalClose.Default: Require bag number on final close

RequireBagNumberOnShiftOpening.Default: Require bag number on shift opening

POS_CategoryBrowserHint.Default: Controls the activation of two tabs on POS ("Events" and "Products" which are shown along with catalogs' tabs). The use of this feature is discouraged because is deprecated, and is kept only for backward compability reasons. Please use catalogs to control POS selling UI.

ManualRedemptionPastDaysHint.Default: How far in the past a ticket/media can be maually redeemed (days)

AccessControlMonitorHint.Default: Ability to use Access Control Monitor module on POS

POS_ShowOfflineStatusHint.Default: Adapt POS' toolbar color to highlight that POS is working in online/offline mode.

POS_ShowUploadStatusHint.Default: Display number of transactions and logs waiting for upload on POS' toolbar

ChangePaymentMethodIdHint.Default: Payment method to be used as "change" in POS transactions when the tendered amount is greater than the due amount. By default, the *payment method* used for change is the **Basic** *payment type*, which has the **Default** flag checked.

AlternativeChangePaymentMethodsHint.Default: List of alternative payment methods that could be choosed by the operator instead of the default/configured one.

AlternativeChangeThresholdHint.Default: Indicates that the "alternative change" prompt should be shown to the user only when the change is above or equal the specified threshold.

TipOnPaymentHint.Default: Show tip options on payment screen

SimulateRotationsHint.Default: Grant ability to manually input simulated rotations

StoreRepositoryProxyAuthenticationHint.Default: When active, SnApp endpoint '/storerepository' will validate connection JWT token.

PortfolioLockOnValidateHint.Default: Locks the portfolio (or the account when possible) during the redemption process to avoid multiple concurrent redemption of the same product. In a scenario where you have multiple medias pointing to the same portfolio, it is possible that scanning two medias of the same portfolio simultaneously ends up in redeeming twice the same product as an "entry", where instead it should be 1 "entry" and 1 "re-entry". This feature could have an impact on redemption performances, sinces it adds some extra work. Therefore it is suggested to keep it disabled on environments where the described scenario is not a possible option.

BackofficeURLHint.Default: Backoffice URL to be used for automated processes like POS installation wizard

BagNumberMaxLengthHint.Default: Define the maximum length of a bag number, user must insert at most these number of numbers

BagNumberMinLengthHint.Default: Define the minimum length of a bag number, user must insert at least these number of numbers

BagNumberFormatHint.Default: Define the format bag number (numeric or alphanumeric): - NUMERIC: accept only numeric characters (from 0 to 9) - ALPHANUMERIC: accept alphanumeric characters (from 0 to 9 and from A to Z)

BoxLevelHint.Default: Control when a new box shall be opened for the same operator on the same day: - **Location**: 1 box for each *operator*, for each *day*, for each *location* - **Operating Area**: 1 box for each *operator*, for each *day*, for each *operating area*

SaleQuantityWarnLimitHint.Default: Warns, at checkout time, that the transaction contains an high ticket quantity

SaleQuantityLimitHint.Default: The maximum number of product that can be sold in a transaction

SaleQuantityLimitProductTagsHint.Default: The sale quantity limit concerns only the products linked to these tags

FileSizeUploadLimitHint.Default: Maximum file size (in megabyte) allowed for upload

BannedFileExtensionsHint.Default: List of file extesions not allowed for file upload. List is comma separated. Example: exe,bat,vbe

FunctionShortcutsHint.Default:
Shortcut keystrokes are expressed in the form of multiple keys separated by the "+" plus sign.
Allowed keys are: - CTRL - ALT - SHIFT - Any number or English character (0 to 9 and A to Z)
Examples: - CTRL+X - CTRL+SHIFT+A - SHIFT+ALT+T - CTRL+ALT+SHIFT+U

ProductTypeCategoriesHint.Default: Categories for which product types are visible. This right works along with the CRUD defined above (a product type is going to be readable if both the Category and the CRUD match). While CRUD can only prevent a product type from being read (it is still visibile in lists, but unable to open its details), this "categories" parameter will also prevent it to be seen in lists. Note that if no category is specified then no restriction is applied.

ReadOnlyIntentAPIHint.Default: Use read-only replica DB for those APIs which are only reading data (such as searches, lookups, etc...). In order to work correctly, the infrastructure must have an availability group for SQLServer.

CreateTourOperatorHint.Default: Ability to create a **tour operator** account. It allows to create a new organization from the "shopcart account detail dialog". The organization will be automatically flagged as "tour operator". This option is related to POS only and it's anyway subjected to the ability to create an organization.

CreateTourGuideHint.Default: Ability to create a **tour guide** account. It allows to create a new person account from the "shopcart account detail dialog". The account will be automatically flagged as "tour guide". This option is related to POS only and it's anyway subjected to the ability to create an account.

ReservationsHint.Default: Control ability to make a reservation. In case of the **Delete** level, the user will be able to void any order (reservations and straight sales)

EditStopSaleDatesHint.Default:
Ability to edit "stop sale dates" within product type's configuration.
The right is anyway limited by the overall ability to edit that product type. So if this option is active, but the user does not have rights to edit the product type, he will be also prevented from editing the stop sale dates.

ReservationConsignmentHint.Default: Grants the ability to defer the payment of the products of a reservation to the redemption time.

ReservationValidateRestrictedHint.Default: Grants the ability to validate orders containing products flagged as **"Validate security restriction"**.This right is anyway subordinated to the regular **"validate"** permission.

RestrictDepositAmountHint.Default: If active, paid amount must be less than total amount due when processing partial payments

OrderSequenceNumberHint.Default: Unique, autoinc, autogenerated number, generated for each order depending this configuration.

ShowSequenceNumberHint.Default: Configure if the order sequence number should be displayed

ModifyApprovedReservationHint.Default: Ability to change shopcart content (adding/removing items, changing quantites) on an approved reservation.

ModifyPaidReservationHint.Default: Ability to change shopcart content (adding/removing items, changing quantites) on a paid reservation.

WrnOnFutureReservationHint.Default: Show a warning message when validating reservations containing products for future dates

BulkOrderThreasholdHint.Default:
Quantity above an order should be considered a "bulk" order.
Effects: - Backend shopcart validation is disabled - Transaction is uploaded asynchronously even if the system is configured to do it synchronously - POS UI disable the ability to click on shopcart item details

UnlockOtherUserScreenSaverHint.Default: When a workstation is automatically locked because of operator inactivity, it could be turned into a "Screen saver" state because it was in the middle of a transaction. In this case, only the originally logged user is authorized to unlock it and complete the transaction. Enabling this option on a supervisor, allows him to unlock others user stations.

SaleVoidInstallmentHint.Default: Ability to void an order that contains an installment contract. The functionality is anyway subjected to base "Reservations delete" right.

ManualUnlockHint.Default: Manual unlock for: - **Reservations**: reservations opened by a workstation (when an operator loads a reservation in the workstation shopcart, other operators/workstations are prevented from operating on the same reservation). - **Logins**: when an operator logs into a workstation, he is prevented from logging into a different one. (Note that the "unlock" functionality is actually made available in the workstation page instead of the operator one).

ManualUnlockPayByLinkHint.Default: Ability to manually unlock orders temporarly locked for pay-by-link

SaveMediaToPDFHint.Default: Enables the POS user to save the media of a reservation as PDF file.

PDFMediaLocalPathHint.Default: Local path where the POS will save the PDF media produced. If empty, will save the files into the "Downloads" folder.

PromptOrderConfirmationDialogHint.Default: Prompt the operator, at the end of every transaction, asking if he would like to generate an order confirmation

EmptyOrderConfirmationEmailRecipientHint.Default: The order confirmation email is sent also without a recipient. If the recipient is empty the email is sent to the recipients specified into the template.

AutoGenDoc_StraightSaleHint.Default: Print "auto generated docs" automatically during checkout. Without activating this option, the documents can only be generated on demand through the transaction lookup screen.

MonthDateFormatHint.Default: Used in context where the focus is within a month, and may be better to display the day of the week instead of the year.

FiscalDateSwitchHourHint.Default: Used to determine fiscal/statistical date for transactions happening after midnight. Default is 5, meaning that all transactions made between midnight and 5am will be accounted on the previous day. Example: transaction made on new year's eve 1/Jan/2000 at 2am, it will fall into 31/Dec/1999 statistics.

TimeZoneHint.Default: TimeZone setting is inherited down to the location level, where it is used to determine performances date/times

TrnReceiptDoublePrintProductTagsHint.Default: If the transaction contains a product with these tags, the POS will print an additional copy of the transaction receipt

TrnReceiptDoublePrintPromoTagsHint.Default: If the transaction contains a promotion with these tags, the POS will print an additional copy of the transaction receipt

TrnPaymentReceipt_DocTemplateIdHint.Default: Template used ,instead of other template configured, only for payment transaction. Others kinds of transaction (ex. reservation) keeping use other template

TrnReceiptKioskFailure_DocTemplateIdHint.Default: Template used from Kiosk application to print the failed transaction details

TrnReceiptFailureShowAbort.Default: Allow transaction receipt printing failure abort

TrnReceiptIgnoreTrnTypeHint.Default: Skip automatic transaction receipt printing for selected transaction types Receipt reprint will be anyway available for all transaction types

POS_SearchTransactionsByWorkstationHint.Default: In POS, allows user to search transactions by workstation - FALSE: User cannot select a specific workstation to filter transactions, the only options are the current workstation or all the workstations - TRUE: User can select any workstation to filter transactions

POS_SearchTransactionsByUserHint.Default: In POS, allows user to search transaction by users - FALSE: User cannot select a specific user to filter transactions, the only options are the current user or all the users - TRUE: User can select any user to filter transactions

DeadlockRetryHint.Default:
Define how many times, and with which delays, an API call should be automatically re-tried in case **deadlock victim** error. It's known that the database could throw the above error randomly, and microsoft suggested solution is to make further attempts of the same transaction. This parameter is a comma separated list of numbers, where each number defines each attempt's delay in seconds.
**Examples**: - **1,5**: re-try 2 times; 1st after 1 second, 2nd after 5 seconds - **2,4,10**: re-try 3 times; 1st after 2 seconds, 2nd after 4 seconds, 3rd after 10 seconds

EntityChangeRefreshHint.Default: Frequency (in seconds) that the POS should use to check for configuration changes. The check is anyway done at every POS startup.

InactivityResetTimeHint.Default: Used in POS when in Kiosk mode only. It the inactivity timeout, in seconds, when the application should browse back to the main / screen saver status.

ShowUpgradeFullPricesHint.Default: For upgrade/downgrade transactions, SnApp would display the source product with value 0, and the target product with value equals to the difference to be paid. Activating this option, the source product will be display with its purchase price (negative), while the target product with its full sale price (positive).

TrnReceiptPrintUpgradeSourceItemHint.Default: For upgrade/downgrade transactions, indicates whether or not to print the source product item.

TrnReceiptPrintRenewSourceItemHint.Default: For renewal transactions, indicates whether or not to print the source product item.

PriceDisplayTypeHint.Default: Define how product prices are displayed on POS/B2B/CallCenter. It can be hidden, it can follow product type configuration or can be set to always show tax inclusive (gross prices) or tax excluded (net prices)

ShowCurrencySymbolHint.Default: Show currency symbol on POS product type buttons

ShowPriceDifferenceOnUpgradeHint.Default: Show price difference between target and source product on POS product type buttons during upgrade/downgrade

OfflineSameSiteHint.Default: Accept offline media codes encoded by current licensee

OfflineOtherSiteHint.Default: Accept offline media codes encoded by external licensees (list of numeric license ID comma separated)

OfflineAcceptDaysHint.Default: Number of days for which an offline media code is accepted: "empty" means no limitation; 1 means today only; 2 means today and yesterday; etc...

OfflineReconcileMinsHint.Default: Reconcile redemptions for transactions saved "n" minutes after their generation. "Redemption reconciliation" means to lookup for redemptions (saved before the sale transaction) and link them to the right media. Transactions flagged as "offline" are always reconciled.

OfflineProductHint.Default: When an offline media code is accepted, SnApp will encode a new product (and media) of this product type and use it's entitlements to apply validation logics

OfflineTransactionMaxItemsHint.Default: "offline" created products must belong to a transaction. SnApp will not create a new transaction for every product, but will group within the same fiscal day, up to this configured limit.

OfflineWhitelistMinsHint.Default: Minutes after which the differential whitelist files are downloaded by the workstation. Has no effect if "Offline validation level" is not "Whitelist"
