OverrideMediaNotFoundOnlineHint.Default: Determines if an operator can perform an override on a "Media not found" validation result when online.

OverrideMediaNotFoundofflineHint.Default: Determines if an operator can perform an override on a "Media not found" validation result when offline.

OverrideAllowedTimeoutHint.Default: Number of seconds after which the operator cannot override anymore the validation result, manually or using a staff card

PermittedOverridesHint.Default: List of overrides that can be performed by user/workstation

SeatEnvelopeExtraHint.Default: Ability to toggle between default/extra/default+extra envelope visibility

XForwardedForHint.Default:
Some of SnApp beck-end functionalities, such as **API firewall**, need to determine client's IP address. In case the system is setup with a load balancer in front of the tomcats, and the load balancer acts like a proxy, the tomcats will always see the LB's IP address on every call. Load balancers, though, fill the original IP address in the HTTP header with a specific param name: **x-forwarded-for**.
By enabling this option, you allow tomcat to consider x-forwarded-for instead of the regulare TCP connection client. Please be sure to activate this feature only on those system where the load balancer support the feature.
- If header "x-real-ip" is found, it will take precedence on "x-forwarded-for" - If more than 1 IP address (comma separated is found) only the first one will be taken into account

ForceOfflineHint.Default: Forces POS/AppTUR/AccCTRL workstation to operate in offline mode, regadless of the real status of the connectivity.

ProductRefundHint.Default:
Ability to refund products.
This right considers solely the parameter "refundable" on the product type. Other restrictions (such as "refund period", or the "refundable" setting on sale channels) are checked by right "override refund restrictions".
Options: - **INACTIVE:** no product can be refunded - **REFUNDABLE PRODUCTS:** only products set as refundable will be eligible for refund - **ALL PRODUCTS:** products set as non-refundable may also be refundable

PastProductRefundHint.Default: Ability to refund products sold on a past date. - **When not flagged**, only products sold on the current fiscal date are refundable. - **When flagged**, all products are refundable regardless of when they were sold.

OverrideRefundRestrictionsHint.Default: Override refund restrictions such as: - Product type **refund period** - product type **refund fees** - Sale channel **refundable**

PrintFailureFullRefundHint.Default: Upon ticket print failure, the transaction will be aborted and all the tickets will be refunded.

ProductMaxUpgradesHint.Default: Max number of subsequent upgrades allowed. Considering only upgrade done after first usage

IgnoreProductSaleRightsOnQuickUpgrade.Default: Ignore product sale rights on quick upgrade

IgnoreProductSaleRightsOnQuickUpgradeHin.Default: When a product in not sellable due to "sale right" restrictions, it is not even possible to perform an upgrade to it. By enabling this right, an exception is made allowing the upgrade if the product is enlisted as "quick upgrade" in the source product.

AllowUpgradeToAnyProductHint.Default: Upgrade to any product even if it is not in the quick upgrade list

ProductDowngradeInstallmentHint.Default: Ability to perform downgrades on products tied to an installment contract. The functionality is anyway subjected to base "Product downgrade" right.

ProductRefundInstallmentHint.Default: Ability to refund products tied to an installment contract. The functionality is anyway subjected to base "Product refund" right.

TicketTransferHint.Default: Ability to transfer a product from one portfolio/account to another

MaxTicketTransferHint.Default: Number of times that the products can be transferred. When not set is unlimited

TicketMetaDataEditHint.Default: Ability to edit product meta data. The functionality is anyway subjected to meta fields rights.

TraceRedemptionChangesHint.Default: Let the system save all the changes applied to a product's entitlement when the product is redeemed. This option must be enabled to allow the "Redemption void" feature to work

InstallmentContractCancelHint.Default: Cancel scheduled payments and blocks products

BlockUnblockContractsHint.Default: Block\Unblock contracts. - **NO**: disabled - **MANUAL**: Ability to block/unblock contracts (status "manually blocked") - **AUTOMATIC AND BLOCKED**: Ability to remove an "automatic blocked" status and to apply/remove "manual block" statuses

InstallmentContractDocumentHint.Default: Ability to add/edit/remove attachments to existing installment contracts

InstallmentSettlementHint.Default: Ability to select unpaid installment schedules and settle them with any available payment method

ShowInstallmentScheduleDatesHint.Default: Controls the visibility of "scheduled dates" and "next attempt dates" fields for installment contract schedules

WarehouseLoadHint.Default: Ability to load warehouse and move stocks between one warehouse and another

RedemptionLogHint.Default: Ability to view usages both in standalone lists and within products / media details

SecurityEditHint.Default: Shows security tab on people accounts

RightsEditHint.Default: Allow editing of rights dialog on people and organizations. "Security profile" right needs to be enabled as well.

ITMonitorHint.Default: Ability to view pages from "Help", "Monitor" and "System" sections

WalletCreditLimitDefaultHint.Default: Default credit limit set on portofolios. Operators are anyway able to override this default from POS.

MobileWalletTicketTemplateIdHint.Default: Template used to render B2C page "mwlt". The page is used as the landing page to allow a product's **mobile wallet** (ie: **Google Wallet** or **Apple Wallet**) to be installed on mobile devices. The template is designed to contain info about 1 single product. Complete URL of the page is similar to: http://your-snapp.com/b2c?page=mwlt&**ticketId**=???

MobileWalletSaleTemplateIdHint.Default: Template used to render B2C page "mwlt". The page is used as the landing page to allow all orders's **mobile wallets** (ie: **Google Wallet** or **Apple Wallet**) to be installed on mobile devices. The template is designed to contain info about all products of an order. Complete URL of the page is similar to: http://your-snapp.com/b2c?page=mwlt&**saleId**=???

AccountTempPageTemplateIdHint.Default: Custom template for account accreditation page. If none if selected, the system will use the built-it one.

EmailVerifSuccessLandingPageTemplateIdHi.Default: Landing page template for successful email verification

EmailVerifFailureLandingPageTemplateIdHi.Default: Landing page template for failed email verification

ResetPwdSuccessLandingPageTemplateIdHint.Default: Landing page template for successful password reset operation

ResetPwdFailureLandingPageTemplateIdHint.Default: Landing page template for failed password reset operation

AccountInstallment_DefaultCategoryIdHint.Default: Person category that will be used when creating an installment contract payor account

AccountBlockHint.Default: Ability to block an account. In order to block an account the user must have at least the edit rights.

EditAccountCodeHint.Default: Grants ability to edit accounts code. This right is anyway subordinated to the ability to overall edit the account.

DisplayNameFormatHint.Default: Ability to configure the names which will display in the BKO/POS UI for organizations, people and association members. "Default": The system will show the default display name for the account type (e.g. Organizations will display Company Name) "Company Name - Last Name, First Name" OR "Last Name, First Name - Company Name": If a form has been configured to have a Company Name as well as First and Last Name, the system will display all 3 values in one of these two orders. Note: If a grid has been configured, it will override any settings configured here for search result screens only.

TempAccountCategoryHint.Default: Category to be assigned on temporary accounts. When defined: - Enables endpoint **/tempaccount** for the operating area; - Enables POSs from searching through temporary accounts.

SessionCheckSecsHint.Default: Delay (in seconds) after which the back-end should check session token on DB. If the same user logs-in in browser A and the in browser B, the only way to invalidate the session for browser A is to check token validity on database. This parameter allows to avoid to do this check at every single API/page call. If, for instance, is set at 30secs, in the scenario described above, the same user will have 2 session concurrently working for up to 30 seconds.

PasswordBlockTimeHint.Default: Works along with option "Block login after 'n' failed attempts". If this option is set and greater than 0, when a user fails to login for more that 'n' attempts, the system will temporary block his account for the specified minutes.

PasswordExpirationDaysHint.Default: Define when the password will expire (number of days after its creation or update) Values equal or less than 0 mean that the password never expires

PasswordWarning_History.Default: The new password has to be different from previous %1 passwords.

PasswordWarning_MinSymbols.Default: Password must have at least %1 special characters/symbols.

PasswordWarning_MinNumbers.Default: Password must have at least %1 numerical characters.

PasswordWarning_MinUppercase.Default: Password must have at least %1 uppercase characters.

PasswordWarning_MinLowercase.Default: Password must have at least %1 lowercase characters.

PasswordWarning_MinLength.Default: Password is too short. Minimum length should be %1 characters.

PasswordWarning_Expired.Default: Your password has expired. Please change it.

ResetPasswordHint.Default: Password assigned to user when the password is reset.

MaxAmount_ExceededError.Default: Order value exceeds maximum sales amount permitted

ShowPerformanceAvailabilityHint.Default: Show actual remaining capacity of a performance during selection in POS

OverrideUpgradeRestrictionsHint.Default: Ability to override any upgrade/downgrade constraints which may have been configured on the product itself.

CloseDifferentBoxHint.Default: Ability to perform a final close on someone's else box

BoxReceiptReprintHint.Default: Ability to re-print a final-close receipt for any box (including other users')

BoxClosureMaxRetriesHint.Default: On box close operation, the operator will be notified if his input does not match the amounts expected by the system. This parameter controls how many time the user should be asked to re-check his box because of this un-alignment. If the operator cannot make a match between his declaration and the expected values, the box will be flagged as "over-short".

BoxClosureOvershortToleranceHint.Default: On box close operation, if the difference between declared and expected amounts is lower than this tolerance setting, the operator will not be notified about an over-short, and the box will be closed as fine.

BoxStartingFundHint.Default: Initial fund for box creation. If the amount set is greater than 0, the operator will be notified on box creation (after POS login) and a supervisor will be anyway able to override this preset amount.

BoxByWorkstationHint.Default: By default **boxes** follow the user regardless of the workstation they are logged in (if within the same location), assuming that the operator would carry around his phisical box in case he has to change workstation within his shift. By enabling this flag, the logic will be reversed and box will be bound to the workstation regardless of the user logged in.

MinOverrideBoxStartingFundHint.Default: Define the minimum value that can be used to override box starting fund.

MaxOverrideBoxStartingFundHint.Default: Define the maximum value that can be used to override box starting fund.

OverrideBoxStartingFundHint.Default: Ability to override the preconfigured box starting fund of any cashier. The overriden starting amount has to be anyway consistent with potentially configured constraints.

IgnoreBoxStartingFundHint.Default: Ability, for a cashier, to choose to not add the preconfigured starting fund when its shift starts.

BoxReceiptFailureShowAbort.Default: Allow box receipt printing failure abort

BoxCashLimitAlertHint.Default: When a workstation reaches this limit, the operator gets notified on the POS and is suggest to do a withdraw. From backoffice, supervisors can search and check for workstation which reached the limit. Only "cash" and "foreign currency" payment methods are taken into account.

MultipleBoxesInDifferentLocationsHint.Default: When enabled, the system will allow a user which already has an open box at Location A to open a new box for the same fiscal day at Location B

UniqueBagNumberHint.Default: When checked requires unique bag number for the same fiscal date

ReceiptAskForReprintHint.Default: When enabled, the operator will be offered the option to re-print the receipt. This message will continue to display until the operator cancels the prompt.

ApprovedAmount_Error_Autodisabled.Default: Your have exceeded the approved amount limit, order cannot be approved

ApprovedAmount_Error.Default: Your order exceeds your approved amount

CategoryLocation_Error.Default: Selected category does not belong to any authorized locations, please make another selection.

NegativeAmount_Error.Default: %1 can only be a positive amount.

ProductExpDateHint.Default: Enabled products are the ones with the "Change expiration date" option active

ChangeStartValidityHint.Default: Enabled products are the ones with the "Change start validity" option active

MaxProductExpirationDaysHint.Default: Maximum number of days that a products' expiration date can be extended. Limit is calculated using the products' Valid From date.

TicketManualBlockUnblockHint.Default: Ability to set/unset the "manually blocked" status on a product

TicketSupervisorBlockUnblockHint.Default: Ability to set/unset the "verification required" status on a product

ShopCartTimeoutMinsHint.Default: Minutes after which the shopcart should be automatically cleared/emptied. The timer start when the first item of a transaction is added to the cart. If not set, the functionality is disabled.

OfflineModeHint.Default: When disabled, a user will not be able to login to an offline POS. Offline sale attempts made prior to a user reaching the payment page will also be prevented.

MediaAssignLevelHint.Default: Defines under what circumstances a media can be assigned/transferred to an existing account/portfolio. Media assigned to empty and anonymous portfolios are also considered "new media".

MediaAssignLevel_ExistingAnonymousMedia.Default: New or Existing anonymous media only

TicketAssignLevelHint.Default: Defines under what circumstances a new named product can be assigned to a media's portfolio. When the new product is anonymous it can be assigned to any media without any restriction. Media assigned to empty and anonymous portfolios are also considered "new media".

TicketAssignLevel_ExistingAnonymousMedia.Default: New or Existing anonymous media only

ExtMediaBatchLevelHint.Default: Permit to chenge the status of the an external media batch

InstallmentContractVoidOtherDayHint.Default: Permit void of installment contracts on a day subsequent to the contract issuing date

InstallmentContractVoidUsedHint.Default: Permit void of installment contracts containing used products

InstallmentDocAutoSaveHint.Default: Automatically archive generated installment contract document

IgnoreCommissionHint.Default: Ability to avoid commission automatic reversal when performing an order or product refund. On POS, the operator will be prompted about the possibility to choose for this option.

ReverseCommissionHint.Default: Automatically reverse applied commissions when refunding products/orders

FiscalSystemHybridStationHint.Default: Allows "non fiscal" products to be sold on fiscal stations

BiometricHint.Default: Generic flag to allow or prevent biometric functions to be performed

BiometricCheckLevelHint.Default: When set, the system will use the lower value between this and the one set on product type configuration

EnrollmentEntityHint.Default: Defines where biometric templates should be attached. By default, biometric templates are attached to **accounts**, or to the **portfolio** in case it's anonymous. The alternative option is to attach the biometric template on each **product**. This is not the best solution operations wise, but could be mandatory in some country for legal/privacy reasons.

BioExpire_AfterExpirationHint.Default: Number of days, after product expiration (end validity), when the biometric template should be purged This parameter is not considered in case there are biometric expiration rules configured directly on the product type.

BioUseDocumentPictureHint.Default: For those configurations where a document reader on access point is used to trigger face recognition, this parameter allows to enable/disable the sending of the document picture to the FR system.

ManVerProbabilityHint.Default:
Manual verification is performed one out of N where N is the value of "Manual verification probability". This value is meaningful only for products configuerd to require manual verification with frequency configured as "Random".
EXAMPLE: Manual verification probability = 10 Product scanned will have a probability of 1 out of 10 to be selected for a manual verification

PahDownloadOptionHint.Default: Print@Home download option: - FIRST TIME ONLY: The PDF can be generated one time only, this could happen when/if the confirmation email is sent (depending on the flags set during the order placement) or through B2B/CLC/BKO order page. - MEDIA REISSUE: PDF can be printed as many times as wanted, but each time, previous medias will be voided (reissued) and new ones will be created. - MEDIA REPRINT: PDF can be printed as many times as wanted keeping same media/mediacodes.

AccountCategorySelectionHint.Default: Ability to modify the category on accounts

PahMediaActiveHint.Default: When selected, media prepared for download will be generated in **active** status (instead of the default **inactive** status)

OpenTabUIHint.Default: Determine if and how "open tab" functionality is activated on POS: - INACTIVE: functionality not available - ALLOW: every transaction the operator is asked to select/create an open tab, but he/she can click to skip this process - FORCE: every transaction the operator have to select/create an open tab before he/she can commit the transaction - OPTIONAL: transaction flow do not show open tab selection/creation step, but the operator can still select/create an open tab on demand through POS's system functions

OpenTabHint.Default: Determine if and how "open tab" functionality is activated on BKO

OrganizeAutoCheckoutHint.Default: After confirming grouping of products the system will go to the checkout step

AccessPointGuestMsgDelayHint.Default: Percistency of guest message on access point display in milliseconds

AccessPointOperatorMsgDelayHint.Default: Percistency of operator message on access point display in milliseconds

AccessPointDisplay1Hint.Default: Configure which type of messages have to be shown on display1

AccessPointDisplay2Hint.Default: Configure which type of messages have to be shown on display2

GroupBiometricComparisonLimitHint.Default: Check biometric template against products purchased in the same transaction. In order to avoid system slow downs, this parameter limits the number of 'linked templates' to be fetched.

GroupBiometricComparisonBulkOrdersHint.Default: Maximum total number of products on a single order where "group biometric comparison" should be performed. If the order contains more products than the specified threshold, "group biometric comparison" is skipped. On bulk orders, where products are distributed to different families or group of guests, biometric comparison doesn't make sense.

GroupBiometricComparisonTypeHint.Default: Define if and how the biometric template should be checked against all products sold in the same transaction: - **Same ticket only**: only templates linked directly to the scanned product will be considered. - **Same product only**: check against all products of the same product type. - **All**: check against any product type

ShowQuickRenewalScreenHint.Default: On POS, when adding a product to the shopping cart for renewwal, display a screen to list all potential target product types.

WalletCapHint.Default: Maximum allowed amount that can be deposited on a portfolio

WalletMinimumTopupHint.Default: Minimum allowed amount for each single topup transactions

WalletExpirationHint.Default: Number of days of validity of a portfolio's deposit, starting from the last topup.

OverrideOriginalPaymentsRestrictionHint.Default: When refunding products, an operator is normally limited to select from the payment methods used to purchase the product. Enabling this parameter, the operator can select any form of payment.

AllowShowExpectedAmountOnFinalClose.Default: Show expected amount on final close

AlwaysAllowFinalCloseHint.Default: Allows user to perform final close no matter what the status of the box is. E.g., the box can be in an uncertain staus if one of the services that provide its consolidation is not working / has been stopped or if the transactions have not been post processed correctly

MobileApkHint.Default: Mobile APK file to be used (ie: snapp_8_10.apk)

ProductId_ExtPayHint.Default: When charging a wallet through **PORTFOLIO \ WalletPayment** API, SnApp will create a transaction where the payment is Wallet and the sold item the system product type "#EXTPAY - External Payment" Here you can configure a different product type to be used.

MatchSerialAndFiscalDatesHint.Default:
Determines how offline transactions, when uploaded to the server on a different day, are saved for fiscal/statistical purposes.
EXAMPLE: an operator makes an OFFLINE transaction on 31/Dec/1999. At shift end, the system is still offline and operator turns off the computer. On 1/Jan/2000, the operator turns on the computer and the transaction is now uploaded to the server.
**INACTIVE** = transaction is uploaded and saved as Fiscal Date 1/Jan/2000. **ACTIVE** = transaction is uploaded and saved as Fiscal Date 31/Dec/1999.
**It is recommended to leave this option INACTIVE, to prevent the risk of modifying historical financial data.**

ShowPaymnetCutsTabHint.Default: If active POS shows cuts tab as default tab in payment screen

SameMediaReadDelayHint.Default: Delay, in seconds, between two allowed scans on the same media. Used to avoid accidental double scans on the same media.

LogRedemptionUserHint.Default: Track the operator logged in on every product redemption

GroupReentryDelayHint.Default: In case of a product configured as "N scans - N rotations", indicates the time threshold (in minutes) for the system to discriminate between a "group entry" or a "reentry"

BackHomeScreenAfterScanTimeoutSecHint.Default: Seconds that POS has to wait before returning to the home screen afterwards a successful redemption.When not set, POS will keep staying on the redemption screen.

MainPaymentFunctionHint.Default: Define the payment function to be displayed on the payment screen's header bar

AutomaticPaymConfirmationHint.Default: POS will not require any click on payment screen confirmation button when total amount of already paid payments matches the transaction total

MediaLookupManualInputHint.Default: Allow manual input, in addition to reading devices (barcode scanners, RFID readers), to lookup medias and privilege cards

MediaCreateManualInput.Default: Manual input of non existing media

MediaCreateManualInputHint.Default: Allows manual input of media code, in addition to reading devices (barcode scanners, RFID readers) when assigning new media

MediaStatusDamagedRevertHint.Default: Allows media in "damaged" status to be reverted to "Active" or to any other status

ShowAutofillPayments.Default: Show autofill payments in box operations

ShowAutofillPaymentsHint.Default: When checked, will show autofill payment details in deposits and withdrawals but not in final close operations

AutomaticCutAllTicketsHint.Default: When enabled a CUT command will be sent after every ticket, if not enabled the CUT command is sent only once after the last ticket

POS_OverAllDiscountHint.Default: Enable discount button on functions tab during payment

POS_ToggleOfflineModeHint.Default: Enables manual switch to offline mode and back. Use it carefully since uncontrolled offline statuses can expose system vulnerabilities

CaptchaHint.Default: Show a randomly generate CAPTCHA code in the login screen, to be collected in addition to the username and password. It only applies to BKO/CLC/B2B platforms.

ChangePerformanceTimesHint.Default: Maximum number of times that a change performance can be performed to a product. When not set is unlimited.

ChangePerformanceExtHint.Default: Ability to access **elevated/extra** quantities/days when assigning visit date to products

ChangePerformanceDifferentPriceHint.Default: If active, the performance can be swapped with another one that has a different price

ChangePerformanceOnBlockedTicketsHint.Default: Ability to change "visit date" / "time slot" on blocked products (anyway having status lower than 100).

POS_AutoFillUserNameHint.Default: The system automatically populates the login and the supervisor user name with the last one used

POS_MaxRecordsReturnedBySearch.Default: Max number of records returned by search

POS_MaxRecordsReturnedBySearchHint.Default: Only for POS, indicates the max number of records that will be returned in the search results. If during a search the returned records exceed the configured value, the user will be notified by a message.

POS_OrderNotesPopupHint.Default: Define the order notes popup behaviour on POS. - ON DEMAND ONLY: notes popup will be shown only if explicitly requested - OPTIONAL: the system will force the notes popup and the user will be able to complete the order without typing the note - MANDATORY: the system will force the notes popup and the user will have to type the note to complete the order

CreateEmptyAccountHint.Default: When a category is selected and a "real" account is not provided, an empty account will be automatically created for each new portfolio

ShowAllMediaCodesHint.Default: When false only media code "Visual" will be shown in the UI

MediaValidationHint.Default: When true a media validation by a plugin will be required in case of media not existing. POS will raise an error if flag is true and no plugins, able to validate the media, are found.

AssignMediaOfflineHint.Default: When true a media can be assigned also when POS is offline. No checks will be performed and media will always be accepted.

ShowHiddenProductsHint.Default: Ability to see reason why a product type is not shown or disabled on POS

UpgradeTaxCalcTypeHint.Default: When different from "Default" applies selected tax calculation regardless of the product(s) configuration.

HighlightPaymentDataKeysHint.Default: Comma separated list of "payment data" values that need to be displayed directly in lists

ReconcileCreditOnSaleVoidHint.Default: When an order containing "credit" payments is refunded, a negative "credit" is going to be applied to the organization to balance. The positive/negative credits would then need to be manually settled on the POS. By activating this flag, the system will try to automatically reconcile the positive/negative credits. The conditions are: - Positive credit needs to be in **open** status. - Positive/negative credits need to be **same amount** (but opposite sign)

SearchesMaxDateRangeHint.Default: Max date range (number of days) allowed on data searches (ie: orders, transactions, etc...). Insert 0 to disable this feature.

SearchesMaxResultsHint.Default: Prevents data from being displayed at all if the search result exceeds this parameter. Control applies only to: Account searches, Order searches, Transaction searches. Control is anyway ignored when searching order or transactions are filtered by account

SearchesMinDateHint.Default: Insert date in XML format: "YYYY-MM-DD" Prevents from doing searches before the specified date. Control applies only to order and transaction searches.

SearchesMaxPastDaysHint.Default: Prevents from doing searches for more than N days in the past. Control applies only to order and transaction searches.

AllowMediaSearchesByDSSNHint.Default: Allow searching for media by DSSN

AllowProductSearchesByDSSNHint.Default: Allow searching for products by DSSN

CodeAliasEditHint.Default: Ability to edit code aliases for editable object. The user need to have the ability to edit the object and to have this flag enabled.

TaxInInvoiceHint.Default: Enable/disable tax in invoice function on POS

PreventEventSaleHint.Default: Number of hours/days, before a performance beginning, when the performance should be prevented from being sold. For example you could set "1d" on a B2B workstation, in order to prevent it from selling performances for the same day. Accepted values are numbers followed by a letter ("h" as hours, or "d" as days). "2d"="2 days", "12h"="12 hours"

PreventAnonymousPortfolioRedemptionHint.Default: Ability to configure a gate to avoid redemption of tickets not linked to an account

SnAppLoginEnabledHint.Default: The standard SnApp login is enabled. Please check at least one external login plugin is configured an working before disabling this feature

UserSecurityValidator_PluginIdHint.Default: By activating this plugin the back office will send the users on save (update and insert) to the configured service.

ApiTokenCookieSecureHint.Default: Set API token cookies as 'Secure'. Recommended option for security, but it only works if using HTTPS connections.

ApiTokenPOSAgeMinsHint.Default: Token duration in minutes for POS workstations

ApiTokenBKOAgeMinsHint.Default: Token duration in minutes for BackOffice, B2B, CallCenter workstations

ApiTokenMaxExpirationMinsHint.Default: Token max expiration in minutes. Applicable only to external workstations. Token is rejected if the expiration date is too far in the future.

ApiAccessControlAllowOriginHint.Default: Add specified domains to response Header to allow cross site scripting i.e. (http://hostA:8080, http://hostB:8080 ...). For further information please refer to https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/CORS

ResetWorkstationLicenseHint.Default: Ability to reset workstation license and regenerate API encryption keys

GiftCardTotalAmountCapHint.Default: Maximum allowed amount that can be loaded on a gift card

GiftCardMinActivationAmountHint.Default: Minimum allowed amount when activating a gift card

GiftCardMaxActivationAmountHint.Default: Maximum allowed amount when activating a gift card

GiftCardMinReloadAmountHint.Default: Minimum allowed amount for each single reload transaction

ShowPNRHint.Default: Only for POS and only for orders having at least 1 code alias: display first code alias instead of PNR

OrganizeStepHint.Default: Determine if and how "Organize" step is activated on POS: - NEVER: Sale process will never show "Organize" step, regardless of the products configuration - OPTIONAL: Sale process will show "Organize" step before allowing to proceed to checkout only if at least one product is configured to require it - ALWAYS: Sale process will show "Organize" step before allowing to proceed to checkout, regardless of the products configuration

SkipMediaGenerationOrganizeStepHint.Default: When selected, products going through "Organize" step do not generate and print media even if no external media is assigned

ShowOnlyOnEncodingOrganizeStepHint.Default: When selected, sale process will show "Organize" step only if order is going to be encoded

WarnOnUnassignedMediaHint.Default: Display a message on the portfolio organize screen when a user attempts to continue without assigning media during a sale

AdjustAdmissionsCountHint.Default: Ability to add or deduct admission counts by event and performance

MaxAdjustAdmissionsDaysHint.Default: Max number of days that a user can go in the past to adjust the admissions counts

RedemptionInputTypeDefaultHint.Default: Default input type on redemption manual insert

RedemptionInputTypeSwitchHint.Default: Ability to switch between media/document input type on redemption manual insert

OperatorBioOverrideHint.Default: Ability of the operator to skip biometric check during validation

AllowManualEnrollOnInvalidBioEnrollmenHi.Default: Ability of the operator to force enrollment when automatic enrollment fails durinig validation

AllowManualReEnrollOnFailedBioCheckHint.Default: Ability of the operator to force re-enrollment when biometric verification fails durinig validation

CatalogTempFolderHint.Default: Server local folder to be used as temporary location for storing catalog ZIP while being updated. Using OS temp folder as default.

ChangeToCurrentPerformanceHint.Default: Change product's performance to the best match for the local access point

ProductUILogicRefreshPoolSizeHint.Default: Initial size of the thread-pool that in POS handles product's buttons refresh.

ProductUILogicRefreshPoolDelayHint.Default: Delay, in milliseconds, for which product's buttons refresh requests should wait, and potentially grouped.

HistoryHint.Default: Ability to see history details both for generic (main menu) and specific entities

PortfolioHistoryHint.Default: Ability to see portfolio history details

SRV_AsyncFinalizeCheckDBHint.Default:
Post processes are normally processed near real-time, by spawning a new thread right after the main process end (ie: a transaction gets execute, the API response is sent back to the client, a thread for post process is spawn).
However, there are conditions in which this is not possible, and processes are queued on DB for later execution: 1) Tomcat's configured pool is exhausted; 2) Other tomcats have already queued items on DB.
By turning off this option, the tomcat will consider only option #1, not checking DB queue. By choosing this configuration, you need to be sure that there is **at least a tomcat in the system** which is fully dedicated to process queue only (it should never be reached to post transaction, redemptions, etc...). If this condition is not granted, **there is the risk is that the DB queue will never be processed**.

Please note, this functionality operates in tandem with the security profile CRUD locations right

RestrictSecurityProfileCategoriesEditHin.Default: This feature enables the modification of the accounts' security profile exclusively within specified categories. If the account is linked to other categories in addition to the ones specified, modification to the accont's security profile will not be allowed. If no categories are specified, all accounts' security profile can be edited regardless of their associated categories. Please note, this functionality operates in tandem with the security profile CRUD locations right

If no categories are specified, new accounts can be created regardless of their associated categories. Please note, this functionality operates in tandem with the security profile CRUD locations right

RestrictSecurityProfileCategoriesDeleteH.Default: This feature enables the deletion of accounts' security profile exclusively within specified categories. If the account is linked to other categories in addition to the ones specified, deletion of the accont's security profile will not be allowed. If no categories are specified, all accounts' security profile can be deleted regardless of their associated categories. Please note, this functionality operates in tandem with the security profile CRUD locations right

NextTaskHint.Default: Next task to be executed after the current task ends. If the task fails, next task is not executed.

FileNameFormulaHint.Default:
Formula to be filled with variables.
Variable syntax: {VariableName:'format'} *The variable needs to be wrapped in curly brackets. The COLON symbol separates the variable name from its format (delimited by apostrophes)*.
If the variable name start with @ symbol, it indicates to take the value from report parameters.
Currently supported embedded variables are: - **EXECDT**: report's execution date/time - **SEQUENCE**: sequence number - **SERVERID**: ID of the running tomcat instance
For date/time parameters, the format is the one supported by java (see documentation https://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/api/java/time/format/DateTimeFormatter.html).
For integer parameters (like SEQUENCE), the format can be a number representing the number of requested digits (ie {SEQUENCE:3}, where sequence value is 31 will be formatted as '031').
**Example:** - Formula: **WHATEVER-{EXECDT:'yyyyMMdd_HHmm'}-{@FiscalDate:'yyyyMMdd'}-{SEQUENCE:'3'}.csv** - Parameter **EXECDT**: 2010-11-12T14:15:16.789 - Parameter **SEQUENCE**: 31 - Parameter **@FiscalDate**: 2011-12-13 - RESULT: **WHATEVER-20101112-1415-20111213-031.csv**

FileNameRulesHint.Default:
Set of rules to determine the name of the exported file that can be made up of these variables, in this order: - **File name** - **Report's filter** - **Execution date/time** - **Sequence digits**
If the variable "File name" is not valorized, the name of the task will be used in its place. The other variables are optional and will be used to build up the exported file name only if valorized.
Example for task: "Transaction items export" - The task is configured to export the transaction items from the beginning of the previous month (From date). Last month was December 2022 - The "File name" variable is set to "EXPORTED_TRN_ITEMS_" - The "Report's filter" variable is set to "From date" and its format is "Mmm-YY" - The "Execution date/time" variable is set to "Date (yyyymmdd)". Today is the 12th fo January 2023 - The "Sequence digits" variable is set to "3" and the task has already been executed 10 times
The resulting exported file name will be: "EXPORTED_TRN_ITEMS_Dec-22_20230112-011" - **EXPORTED_TRN_ITEMS_** → "File name" - **Dec-22** → "Report's filter" - **20230112** → "Execution date/time" - **011** → "Sequence digits"

FileNameOptionHint.Default: Constant part of the exported file name. If not valorized, the name of the task will be used in its place.

FilterDateOptionHint.Default:
Provides the ability to include a dynamic date parameter into the name of an exported file which is different to the report execution date.
**Example**: Paid transaction report is scheduled to run at 10am each morning and is configured to export data for the previous fiscal date. When the report runs on 15 January, the execution date is 15 January and the fiscal date for the data it is exporting is 14 January. By setting a report date filter, the system can include the fiscal date into the file name itself i.e. PaidTransaction_**20230114**.xls If instead execution date is used, then the report name would be PaidTransaction_**20230115**.xls

SequenceDigitsHint.Default: The length of an auto/incremental number that will be appended at the end of the file name. The sequence will always start from 1 (padded with zeros: ie "001") and will be reset when the max possible number is reached. ie 3 means from 001 to 999

GenerateMD5Hint.Default: The system will generate a second file, with same name, but .MD5 extension. It contains 32 hexadecimal characters representing the 16 bytes MD5 hash of the original file.

NotifyOnDataHint.Default: The generated file will be notified only if it contains actual data

StatsProcessedItemsHint.Default: Refers to "Succeeded / Warning / Failed" counter within each execution

AccountPurge_DemographicHint.Default:
Defines rules on how/when account's demographics should be purged. It applies only to **people** accounts.
Data will be purged based on the account's **retention date**. **Retention date** is a calculated date, which is the maximum date between account's creation date and the latest (most in the future) **valid to** date of its tickets. Accounts can be flagged (Privacy purge lock) to be ignored by this task.
On each form field, it is possible to define if and how that field should be purged: - **None**: data is not going to be purged (ie: you may want not to purge account's country, since it's not a sensitive data and might be useful for marketing/statistical purposes); - **Mask**: data is not completely removed, but is just masked with asteriscs; - **Remove**: data is phisically removed from database.

AccountPurge_DemographicExpirationDaysHi.Default: Number of days, after the account's **retention date**, when account's demographics should be purgedIf value is set to **2** and task runs on Friday, it is going to purge all accounts whose **retention date** is Wednesday or earlier.

ProcessRecover_BaseDate_Hint.Default: Force the task to re-analyze all transactions and redemptions made starting from the specified date. The task works on an "incremental" logic (but never beyond currend date) and this parameter has to be used only on exceptional cases where is needed to redo the recover analysis. This parameter is anyway cleared on each task execution.

ProcessRecover_MissingTimeoutMins_Hint.Default: Defines after how long (in minutes - related to the transaction/redemption date/time) the task should create a missing post process. A too short timeout could lead to cases where the post process gets ran twice, which would cause unpredictable results.

ProcessRecover_HandleMissingProcesses_Hi.Default: Create a process where is missing

ProcessRecover_HandleWorkingProcesses_Hi.Default: Re-execute processes which are in "working" status for longer than "n" hours

ProcessRecover_WorkingTimeoutHours_Hint.Default: Numbers of hours, after which a process in "working" status is likely to be hung, and therefore re-executed

SeatEnvelopeSwap_RetryMinsHint.Default: Minutes that the system should wait before re-trying (after a failure at first-scheduled attempt) to swap envelope seats of a performance

MediaRecycle_ValidityDaysHint.Default: Number if days from media issuing date

LedgerRecover_Description.Default:
The purpose of this task is to look for all transaction and redemptions which don't have a related ledger, and re-apply current ledger-rules. The task should never be scheduled for automatic execution, but only run manually on necessity.
Transactions with missing or failed post process will be skipped, as they will be handled by "Process recover" task.
The reason why you may need the execution of this task are: - Ledger rules where mis-configured - A system malfunction didn't process rules as expected
All analyzed transactions/redemptions will increase counter: - Succeeded: when it is skipped for any reason (which is anyway logged on TRACE level) - Warn: when it is posted (successfully) for ledger rules re-application - Error: when it is posted (failing) for ledger rules re-application

LedgerRecover_BaseDate_Hint.Default: Force the task to re-analyze all transactions and redemptions made starting from the specified date. The task works on an "incremental" logic (but never beyond currend date) and this parameter has to be used only on exceptional cases where is needed to redo the recover analysis. This parameter is anyway cleared on each task execution.

TaskType_SaleCapacityHoldPurgeInfo.Default: Releases sale capacity for expired holds

TaskType_ExternalBiometricTemplatePurgeI.Default: Purge all deleted biometric templates from remote system

TaskType_DBUpdateStatsHint.Default:
The task executes MSSQL command "UPDATE STATISTICS [table] WITH FULLSCAN" on each database table.
Keeping database statistics updated is an important matter, because these statistics are used by SQLServer to choose the most appropriate query plan when executing queries. Not using the most appropriate query plan could lead to massive performance degradation.

OrderWaitPayPurge_TimeoutMinsHint.Default: Number of minutes, after order creation, when it should be voided by the system. Please be sure this timeout to be greater than the bank one, otherwise payments could get through when the order is already voided, creating financial discrepancies.

InvoiceIssue_OrganizationTagsHint.Default: Tags of the organizations to include in the order selection. When empty, no filter on organization is applied.

InvoiceIssue_OpenCreditsOnlyHint.Default: Include only orders paid on credit line, where the credit is still unsettled

InvoiceIssue_SendEmailHint.Default: Send an email with the invoices to each client. Offers the option to choose which demographic field use as email recipient address.

InvoiceIssue_SendEmailNegativeHint.Default: Send the email even if the invoice amount is negative

InvoiceIssue_EmailFieldHint.Default: Account's field containing receipient email address

ResMaintenance_ResPayment_Hint.Default:
Automatically apply payments to orders which passed their scheduled payment date. Scheduled payment date is calculated when the order is created and kept updated at any order change as long as the order state remains "Approved". Scheduled payment date calculation, and the payment method to be used, are taken from the order's owner account (organization's finance tab)
**Example**: If current **fiscal date** is 10/09/2021, the task will pay all orders with a scheduled payment date which is BEFORE 10/09/2021

ResMaintenance_Encoding_Hint.Default:
Encode any paid order which is considered expired (where the visit date is past). If the order has more than one visit date, the last one will be used. Encoding paid expired orders is required to let all the ledger rules based on product expiration to trigger as per normal, granting correct revenue recognition.
**Example**: If current **fiscal date** is 10/09/2021 and "**Encode expired order**" parameter is equal 1, the task will encode all orders with an expired visit date which is BEFORE 09/09/2021.

ResMaintenance_DaysFromPerformanceHint.Default: Number of days before the earliest performance booked. 0 means the fiscal date when the task is run

ResMaintenance_DaysFromReservationHint.Default: Number of days after the reservation creation. 0 means the fiscal date when the task is run

ResMaintenance_VoidReservationHint.Default: Automatically delete all the reservations matching the criteria

Task.ResMaintenance_VoidReservationHint: 自动删除所有符合条件的预约

ResMaintenance_AdminEmailHint.Default: Sends an email with a recap of the reservations matching the criteria

Task.ResMaintenance_AdminEmailHint: 针对符合标准的预约发送电子邮件

ResMaintenance_ClientEmailHint.Default: Sends an email to the reservation account for each reservation matching the criteria

Task.ResMaintenance_ClientEmailHint: 针对符合标准的预约发送邮件至预约账号

ResMaintenance_EncodeExpiredOrdersHint.Default: Number of days, after reservation expiration. When a reservation never gets printed (ie: the guest does not show up), payments collected for that order will never be accrued because tickets are not yet encoded. This option allows to automatically encode reservations which fall into this scenario, so that product clearing rules can be applied

ResMaintenance_AutopayOpenResHint.Default: Allow the task to automatically pay open orders using the parameters configured on the organization linked

CryptoMaintenance_PersistenceDaysHint.Default: Regenerate keys (re-encrypting dependant data) older than the specified number of days

AmortizationIntegrity_SimulateWriting_Hi.Default: Task will perform all checks and write all logs but will not change any data in the DB

AmortizationIntegrity_ReferenceDate_Hint.Default: Allow the task to analyze products used, upgraded or renewed in a specific date range. If "Reference date" is set to "Date range" it will be automatically set to "Previous fiscal date" after each task execution.

AmortizationIntegrity_FutureDateError.Default: "From date" or "To date " cannot be in the future

AmortizationIntegrity_Description.Default:
The purpose of this task is to look for all tickets used, upgraded or renewed which require amortization periods and to verify the choerence between the periods created and the periods obtained by the configuration.
If the number of periods is different the task will update the ticket with the correct number ones.
Behaviour constraints: - No "Applied" or "Voided" periods will be updated/removed - Periods will never be updated with a date which is before the date of the task execution - Total amount of the updated periods will never be higher that the clearing left at the time of task execution

ReleaseFrozenSeatsHint.Default: Persistence (hours) of frozen seats, the minimun value allowed is 1

ProductTypePriceExport_DateInterval_Erro.Default: Date interval is null or invalid. Task cannot be executed

ProductTypePriceExport_FileNamePrefix_Er.Default: File name prefix is null or invalid. Task cannot be executed

ProductTypePriceExport_Tag_ErrorMessage.Default: Product tag is null or invalid. Task cannot be executed

ProductTypePriceExport_Description.Default:
The purpose of this task is to look for the face price for all the products of a specific product tag within the defined date interval
Behaviour constraints:
- Only products valid for sale should be exported
- This includes factoring the active/inactive dates of the product’s visit calendar attached in the configuration of the product
- If a specific product is not available for sale for a specific date (where visit calendar = inactive for that date or product is no longer sellable), that product type should not be exported for that specific date in the file

ProductTypePriceExport_Tag_Hint.Default: Product tags required for the export

ProductTypePriceExport_FileNamePrefix_Hi.Default: File name convention for the file export: FileNamePrefixYYYYMMDDHHmmSS.csv. Example: EPP_YYYYMMDDHHmmSS.csv

ProductTypePriceExport_DateInterval_Hint.Default: Number of days to consider. 1. will export today's product pricing. 14. will export the next 14 days worth of product pricing starting from today's date; etc...

ProductTypePriceExport_Metafield_Hint.Default: Product metafield required for the export

The product entitlements, expiration and amortization periods will be automatically replaced (if needed) when the product is specifically accessed by the system (unique search, ticket scan, financial task etc).

SelectFile.Default: Select a file from your computer

BannedFileExtensionsError.Default: Value not valid. Provide a comma separated list of file extensions

VoucherMaxQtyError.Default: Cannot select more than %1 product(s) for voucher "%2"

VoucherMaxAmountError.Default: Voucher "%1" total amount higher than the remaining allowed value [%2]

TooManyTemplates.Default: Please select vouchers belonging to the same template

VoucherMaxQuantityMinimumError.Default: Cannot generate voucher(s), 'Max quantity' must be equal or more to the sum of products 'Min quantity'

VoucherMaxAmountMinimumError.Default: Cannot generate voucher(s), 'Max amount' must be equal or more to the sum of products 'Min quantity' multiply by 'Unit amount'

VoucherLockNotes.Default: Voucher "%1" is locked because in use

QuantityMaxHint.Default: Total max quantity of products that can be redeemed for this voucher. The quantity is checked at POS upon redeem.

AmountMaxHint.Default: Total amount that can be redeemed for this voucher. The amount is checked at POS upon redeem. If specified, the value represents also the maximum exposure and is used to determine available credit.

VoucherItemEmpty.Default: Please select at least one item

VoucherRedeemMultipleOrgsError.Default: Cannot redeem vouchers issued by different organizations

SelectActivationKeyError.Default: Please select at least one activation key

ApiDebugModeHint.Default: Return full stack trace to the API client in case of errors/exceptions

ExtLicenseIDsHint.Default: List of license IDs which are accepted for transactions. External license IDs allow to specify fixed ticket's encoding date and serials. The list is expressed in a comma separated list of values. Example: "1001,1002,1003"

CrossPlatformRefHint.Default: Workstation ID in the partner's system

ApiKeyHint.Default: Private key for API security. It's issued by the partner's system

PriceNotValidForCrossPlatform.Default: Price not valid for cross platform '%1'

CrossPlatformAlreadyAssigned.Default: Cross platform already assigned to product

AnotherCrossProductAlreadyAssigned.Default: Another cross product from cross platform %1 already assigned

CannotChangeStatus.Default: Status cannot be changed from "%1" to "%2"

ConfirmApproval_Line1.Default: %1 will be allowed to share specific products with you, sell specific products on behalf of you and vice versa.

ConfirmApproval_Line2.Default: Shared products and sellable products need to be configured on both platforms.

ConfirmApproval_Line3.Default: Please select a sale channel and a catalog to be assigned to %1.

SameLicenseError.Default: Cross platform cannot have same license id [%1] of requesting platform

CrossPlatformCommunicationError.Default: Unable to establish communication with cross platform [Error message: %1]

CrossPlatformCommunicationErrorSimple.Default: Unable to establish communication with cross platform "%1"

CrossPlatformFinanceError.Default: Order cannot be completed due to inability to fulfil package components on the cross platform partner system. Please contact your supervisor for assistance.

LangISOsHint.Default: Languages available for kiosk. The system will use provided "translation" on the UI or will use default one if missing. If only one language is available (or non is set), the language selection screen will not be shown.

ServicesHint.Default: Services available for kiosk. If only one service is available, the service selection screen will not be shown.

PrintOptionsHint.Default: Print options available for kiosk. If only one option is available, the print option selection screen will not be shown.

BackgroundImageHint.Default: Blurred background image displayed across all kiosk screens

VideoHint.Default: Video displayed on the idle screen

PINHint.Default: PIN to access the maintenance screen. When used, it must be preceeded by 2 digits of the current day of the month

CarouselImagesHint.Default: Images displayed on the idle screen in a rotation carousel.

HeaderHint.Default: Header shown over all screens. Default is the location name.

TitleHint.Default: Title shown in big font at the top of the screen.

SubtitleHint.Default: Message shown in smaller font right below the screen's title.

BackButtonCaptionHint.Default: Label for the "BACK" button at the bottom of the screen.

NextButtonCaptionHint.Default: Label for the "NEXT" button at the bottom of the screen.

Idle_Footer1Hint.Default: First line of the text displayed in the footer section of the **idle** screen.

Idle_Footer2Hint.Default: Second line of the text displayed in the footer section of the **idle** screen.

Home_TrnPurchaseTicketHint.Default: Text displayed for the "purchase tickets" service.

Home_TrnOrderPickupHint.Default: Text displayed for the "order pickup" service.

Home_TrnWalletTopupHint.Default: Text displayed for the "wallet topup" service.

Home_TrnHint.Default: Hint displayed on the home screen.

Catalog_ClearButtonCaptionHint.Default: Caption for the "CLEAR" button displayed at the bottom of the screen in place of the "BACK" one when the shopcart contains items.

Recap_AddonHintHint.Default: Add-ons hint displayed in the screen.

Paysel_PayCreditCardHint.Default: Text displayed for "credit card" payment method.

OrderInfo_ReissueTicketsButtonCaptionHin.Default: Label for the "Reissue ticket" button at the bottom of the order info screen.

OrderInfo_CompleteOrderButtonCaptionHint.Default: Label for the "Complete order" button at the bottom of the order info screen.

PrintSel_PrintTicketTicketHint.Default: Text displayed for the "print tickets" option.

PrintSel_GoGreenHint.Default: Text displayed for the "go green" option.
